Praktyki Zagraniczne dla Zespołu Szkół Zawodowych im. S. Staszica w Opolu

The Project titled "Internships for ZSZ im. S. Staszica" provides for the organization 3 weeks long mobilities for 32 students learning for the following professions:
- Digital Graphic Designer - 20 persons (10 persons will go to Derry in Northern Ireland and 10 will go to Florence in Italy)
- Analyst - 6 persons will go to Florence in Italy
- Logistic specialist - 6 persons will go to Derry in Northern Ireland

The motilities will take place between January and July of 2015.
Before the motilities students will receive comprehensive  - linguistic course, culture and pedagogical training. During the Project, Leader and Partners will use the tools developed by the project EuPQua ECVET 2 - European Partnership for Quality in Vocational Training. 

The project will be one of the first vet mobilitie projects in Opole. After the project students will increase their competitiveness in the labor market.

The main idea of the project is to enable participation of the students of  Complex of Upper Secondary Schools in  in Lubań in vocational trainings abroad in following areas:
- technician of hotel management
- technician of nutrition and food service
- technician of advertising management
All together, 70 students will participate in the internships assisted by 5 instructors.  All participants is going to take part in preparation cycle, based on developed methodology. It covers language crush – course, pedagogical and cultural preparation and evaluation of personal development during the project. At the end, the conference about the results and achievements of the project is scheduled. 
The project is based on  c lose cooperation of the partners based on tools and documents prepared in such projects as EuPQuA I, II, III and adjustments of methodology during the process to reach the best results possible. 
The final outcome, among others, is going to be improvement of the service provided by the schools, better practical preparation of students and, in long run, development of commerce in the region.
The internships are going to be done in Sep. - Dec. 2014, while the whole project is scheduled for the period 1 July 2014 – 30 June 2015.

The main idea of the project "Praktyki zagraniczne - wiedza , umiejętności, doświadczenie" has been designed to enable students of the  Complex of  General and Vocational Schools in  Gryfów Śląski to take part in an abroad professional experience in the professions of: 
- economy - 2 students
- IT technician - 23 students
- traders - 10 students
All together, 35 students and 2 teachers (1 per hosting country) will participate in the internships.  All participants will take part in preparation cycle, based on developed methodology. It covers language crush – course, pedagogical and cultural preparation and evaluation of personal development during the project. At the end, the conference about the results and achievments of the project is scheduled. 
The project is based on  close cooperation of the partners based on tools and documents assisting ECVET system (MOU or LA)  and adjustments of methodology during the process to reach the best results possible. 
The final outcome, among others, is going to be improvment of the service provided by the schools, better practical preparation of students and, in long run, development of commerce in the region.
The internships are going to be done in August 2014, while the whole project is scheduled for a 12 months period - till the end of June 2015.
European Mobility: Key Opportunity for a New Generation

The goal of ADICE, and of the project, is to ensure the social and professional development of the learners (including those with fewer opportunities), by participating in a valuable mobility experience. ADICE considers the mobility as a tool allowing the development of technical, transverse and social skills favoring the access to the market of the employment. Furthermore, the labor pool of the Lille metropolis, and Roubaix-Tourcoing in particular, is characterized by a strong unemployment rate and by an existence of districts enclosed socially and economically, what underlines the relevance of the activities of the ADICE and this project. 



The project "European Mobility: Key Opportunity for a New Generation" is planned for two years, from the 1st of July 2014, the sending of 60 learners in vocational training, in mobility for purposes of learning, in the eligible countries of the European Union: in United Kingdom, in Malta, in Italy, Ireland, Portugal, Austria, Germany, Spain, Poland and Greece.

The mobility project will be internship in an enterprise or in a non-profit organization for 3 months, 6 months or 10 months. 

The project plans also 5 projects of mobility for the staffs of the vocational training, for the activities of education and training in Spain, in United Kingdom and in Italy for durations of one week and two weeks.



In this project, ADICE will accompany people in vocational training (or having obtained their diploma there is less than year) as well as members of their staff. Furthermore, ADICE is in the course of request of accreditation of training institution with the prefecture of the North, what should be granted during year 2014.



Professional internship will be organized and defined according the experience, the sector of activity, the professional project, the needs, the expectations in short and long term and the profile of the participants. Indeed, ADICE’s goals are to promote the European mobility, to fight against discriminations and to promote people with fewer opportunities at a social and professional level. Our public is diverse and our projects are open for all learners of the region, without any discrimination, any level of studies is required or limited age, the destination, duration, various sectors of activity, but are more characterized by the objectives and profile of each person. Applications are thus estimated with regard to all these criteria and on the coherence of the project of the person. 



At the level of the European partners, we work on one hand with intermediate structures asked to organize the mobility of the participants, and it to supply an on-the-spot support and a necessary frame for the participants having more difficulties. On the other hand, we work also more and more with direct  structure, selected specially for a project or having already welcomed our participants within their structures.

Our partners' network is characterized by a geographical, linguistic and economic diversity (Germany, Ireland, Italy, Spain, Poland, the United Kingdom, etc.) and a plurality of activities sectors adapted to every public (social, tourism, sale, communication, etc.) and of types of structures (companies, associations) Every partner, whether it is a direct structure or intermediate structure, is in charge of supplying a quality placement (within its structure or with one of his local partners), and if possible the accommodation and the language courses (if the project is realized outside the countries where the official language is English, French, Italian, German or Spanish). Of more the partner owes bring a quality follow-up and an evaluation of the end of project.

Moreover, the partner has to bring a quality follow-up and an evaluation of the relevant and adapted end of project. The diversity of the partners of  ADICE allows us to answer the majority of the requests  of the candidates. Indeed, we are able to propose internships as well in companies as in associations, in number varied by professional sectors.

The project 'Fachowo - zawodowo ' is aimed at 75 students (including 45 girls and 30 boys ) of Zespół Szkół Nr 1 im.  Zgierz of the following professions :

1. tourist services  - 16 students ( 12 girls and 4boys )

2. nutrition and food services - 34 students ( 21 girls and 13 boys )

3. digital image processing  - 13 students ( 4girls and 9 boys )

4. economists -  12 students ( 8 girls and 4boys ) .

The main aims, based on the needs of the participants and the participants, schools and employers , are as follows:

1. to improve the quality of practical training at school

2. to enable  the acquisition of practical skills, which would turn attractive on the labour market ,

3. enhancing growth in language and social skills of participating students ,

4. students' personal development,

5. to enable the participants to get acquainted with the requirements of the European labour market, as well as its operating rules.

The participants of the project will take part in:

1. a 20 - hour course of basic skills in Spanish , aimed at learning basic professional vocabulary useful at work and basic phrases used in interpersonal relations ,

2. a 20 -hour course of English , reminding the vocabulary and phrases gained in the course of school.

3. a 8-hour cultural preparation and guidance .



Preparation courses  will lead to a two-week internships in the following locations:

1. students in the professions of tourist services (16 participants) nutrition and food services  (27 participants) are scheduled for the training in Valencia, Spain 

2. students in the professions of economist (12 participants), digital graphics processing (13 learners) and  nutrition and catering services (7 students) will take part in the training in  Londonderry in Northern Ireland in the UK. 



Foreign partners, participating  in the project, will provide all the participants with an attractive place for the training , mentoring and interesting cultural preparation .



All the activities mentioned above are thought to enable the project to achieve  the following results:



1. the school (the applicant) will improve the quality of vocational training,

2. 75 participating students will raise their professional skills ,

3. 75 participating students will  raise their language and social skills, 

4. at least 80 % of the participants will notice their personal development ( self-esteem, self-confidence , self-reliance , etc. )

5. at least 80 % of the participants will raise their consciousness to  freely choose their place of work.

The project will have an impact on its participants, school , employers, local community , local authorities and other subjects  in the country and the European Union.
Wspólnie tworzymy warsztat pracy. Uczniowie i nauczyciele Zespołu Szkół nr 5 w Irlandii Północnej.

The project provides for a two-week trip students professional experience to Londonderry in the UK in accordance with the directions of education students majoring in techniques of hairdressing services held an internship in hair salons , the students towards the techniques of landscape architecture will internship in companies designing gardens and students from the direction of tourist service technician will take an internship in hotels. Departure will take place in May 2015 , after completing the preparatory program , which will include an English language course work, lectures on the history and geography of the United Kingdom and the seizure of counseling .  This will be another English course training in Derry and two trips to the Ulster American Folk Park and the Atlantic coast . Another trip , provided the project is a 7 day stay vocational teachers in the context of job shadowing . Teachers will observe the work in the same enterprise as students to eventually be able to cooperate after the return of the workshops , where teachers and students jointly develop a brochure , which will show in a very approachable and inviting, it's worth it to start a company and thus escape the spectrum unemployment. The brochure will present , as in a safe, lawful , subject to the basic principles of economics and success can be the boss himself . The resulting document will be one of the most important elements showing the value of the project . Other important aspects of the project will : strengthen the professional , social, cultural and linguistic backgrounds of both students and teachers. A possibility of cooperation in the framework of the workshop . where students are partners in the discussion in relation to teachers will allow you develop good, honest relationships between teachers and their charges .

Number and profile of the participants : 48 young trainees enrolled in any of the Vocational Centres that take part in this project, in any of the following intermediate educational level : Microcomputer Systems Networking , electrotechnical installations Pharmacy and Pharmaceuticals, Machining , Physical Activity in the Natural Environment . The age of the participants will be between 18 and 25 and have no previous work experience. 



Twenty posts are reserved for senior students of these 3  vocational centres: IES Gonzalo Nazareno , Arenal and Hermanos Machado (just for students of physical activity in the natural environment),  and the remaining twenty-eight posts will be reserved for students recently qualified from any other of the vocational centres participant in this project. 

Program: 

Training period of 16 weeks for students newly qualified. 

Training period of 10 weeks for students who will complete their compulsory Vocational Training period in the following countries: 

in: Germany, Bulgary, Greece, Irleland, Italy, Portugal and United Kingdom.



Activities to perform: Identification of needs , creation of local network, meetings for the preparation of this proposal, survey on the potential target audience to test project acceptance , creation of transnational networking, information , recruitment, selection and preparation of participants , organization of logistics and paperwork, departure to destination countries, trainings starting and follow up,  monitoring, evaluation of participants , validation and certification of students, certificates delivery, overall project evaluation , impact, justification before the OAPEE , employability assessment , dissemination of results.



. 

Expected outcomes and impact:

For the participants : 

Acquire the specific expertise needed in their professional sectors- • Have a first professional experience - • Get a versatile and multi-skilled professional profile, capable of adapting to the specific needs of each company - • Acquire / improve knowledge of different languages and cultures of the host countries - • know and use different applications of new technologies in the working environment where they complete the internship - • Knowing the production and management systems in each sector - • Acquiring a high qualified training which will enable them to be competitive - • obtain an official recognition ( Europass ) through the validation and accreditation of the skills acquired in this period of work experience - • Standing out among job seekers when entering into the labour market - • on a personal level , improve their skills and individual and transversal competences,  strengthening entrepreneurship  spirit,  improve their ability to adapt to changes. Reduce geographic, linguistic and economic barriers that must be faced when living in a foreign country.



For partners and for the coordinator: 

Promoting the mobility of  our young people ; Promoting personal, social and professional development of the participants; Promoting specialized training according to each participant profile; Make the participants know new business organization models, as well as new methods and  working tools ; Enhance and strengthen the knowledge of foreign languages. Use new technologies as a tool for everyday work; Enhance interest in training so that the rate of absenteeism is reduced. Create a transnational network of cooperation between companies and public and private entities. Enable the integration of our young people in the labor market at local and European levels. Reduce the unemployment rate.



Long terms benefits: 

Strengthen our network and facilitate the exchange of ideas and projects. 

The partners will increase their network,  will benefit from the shared experience will adapt the knowledge they will gain during the mobility to their schools (eg implementation of new technologies or methods of work, introduction of new elements in teaching programs, etc.) and will disseminate the results in other centers. The partners also seek to consolidate its internationalization in mobility projects as part of a long-term strategy. Therefore, we hope that this project will help us to develop our long-term partnership, and in the future we hope to further engage other public and private institutions to participate in future proposals

BACKGROUND

A shared mission and  aim within the Consortium is the internationalisation of the educational offer of the VET schools, partners in the  project, as a mainstreaming effect of what other partners have done so far in the territory with respect to European mobility for vocational training and learning.

The project is also meant to make  young vet learners experience mobility as young European citizens, fostering in them a feeling of appeal, attractiveness and belonging to Europe. The project title itself stands for this mission: The synergy between Younger generations and Europe goes through this doubleoffer of chances on one hand and empathy and belonging on the other one.



OBJECTIVES

 To  foster and strengthen European dimension in VET education.

 To think of young learners as resources for their territory in view of the educational, vocational and professional investment they can make  by experiencing Europe and the European Labour market as a unique chance for personal growth and development.

 To facilitate  change and innovation, aligning vocational profile to the key economic sectors of a territory and its demand  for new key skills which can be acquired or enhanced through European mobility for training.

 Hence,  to support future employability of vet learners and facilitating the transition fron vet learning to the labour market



TARGET GROUP

95 Vet learners  ( aged 17-19 ) 50%: students in the fourth year of Vet Education , 15%: students in their last year of VET Education,  35%: nee graduates from VET Education leaving within one year’s end from their VET studies.





PROGRAMME OUTLINE



Vet training programmes of 4-6-8 weeks depending on the age and level of VET studies of the beneficiaries.



Sectors of VET training in companies: 

 Marketing – foreign trade with a focus on businesses internationalisation

 Tourism,  with afocus on cultural promotion and customer care and assitance

 Finance and administration with a focus on logistic and shipping

 Agronomy and food industry for the strong link with the agro-food industry of the territory and its latest growth and expansion. 



Countries: FR, ES, DE, MT, UK.



Preparatory activities

 Module: Let’s meet Europe: to inform and build up awarenss on the European policies for Youth, Education and Labour with a focus on the chances offered to young learners and workers  by the new European Programmes.

 Counselling: a module devised to help VET learners and  VET new graduates  to get awareness on their resources, attitudes and skills and learn how to put them in relation to their choices and plans for future studies of research of a job after their diploma. A great emphasis will be given to those skills which lead to entrepreneurship as a key factor in smoothing the way to coherent choices in studies and in job applications.



 Language and Vet module in the Host organisation





METHODOLOGY

Integrated approach of counselling and non formal learning in the form of training mobility and education to Europe, which meets at one time  educational, vocational, information and civic needs in a coherent framework of  the guidelines set in the Strategies for Europe 2020, in terms of key skills and a new approach in counselling which focuses on “education to employability”.

The approach in the counselling given to beneficiaries will prove to be suitable to transfer a methodology  the students can rely on  beyond the mobility life-cycle and after their studies, which help them to make choices in studies and plan their job applications with a better awareness of their resources, of how to link them to attitudes on  one hand and to what the Labour market is looking for so as to be and feel more employable.



EXPECTED OUTCOMES

 For sending schools: 

a great chance  and a pathway to international experiences, bringing competitiveness in their educational and vocational offer, casting the bridge to an easier access to the labour  market for their learners.

 For the beneficiaries:  

The  learning  outcomes are meant in terms of development of key skills (soft skills and enterpreneurship, language skills and technical skills aligned to the needs of the economic sectors of the territory).

They grow up as European citizens and their European awareness  and belonging

They benefit from  measures of education to employability, which support  more effectively their future choices and also contribute  to their self awareness and self-confidence, as long as they learn to think of them self as a resource





LONGER TERM BENEFITS

 The methodology above described will support the beneficiaries mid term, beyond the lifecyle of their mobility.

 The mobility methodology and the mobility tools shared through the Coordinator’s know-how will support the quality management of mobility itself, while the expected results on schools and beneficiaries hopefully will have a mainstreaming effect, attracting new schools for future projects, strengthening and developing the Consortium.

The RE-NERGY Project, with the proposal of  5 weeks transnational mobility,  renews its commitment in the field of vocational training by focusing on new themes, but always starting from the needs of the cluster, as a response to the training needs of the productive sectors of the eastern provinces Piedmont (especially Alessandria Province). The focus then becomes polarized toward the handicraft sector and SMEs, with attention to the construction sector, green technologies for energy conservation, rehabilitation and restoration. The training contents of the project include the following topics a) the growth of professional skills in relation to recovery, maintenance and reorganization of the territory and its redevelopment (primarily energy and sustainable one) b) the development of awareness about the need for interaction among different profiles. This is true within a single sector and among different sectors. Transnational mobility is an opportunity for the development of key competencies as digital competence , communication, self-learning, as the basis of a vocational path and personal growth. In addition, the integration of different professions and sectors as proposed by the project will be reflected in order to dialogue with other mobility projects proposed by high schools networks that insist on the same territory. The 100 participants in the project will be selected among the students of 5 High of the Province of Alessandria, who have completed the fourth and penultimate year. The fields of study belong to the Vocational  sector (Maintenance and technical assistance) and Technical-technological sector. The close connection among the educational schools and the stakeholders of the territory have allowed to identify more precisely the ideal destination  to facilitate the achievement of the goals:  Spain,  Czech Republic, UK, Estonia. The placement phase will involve, after a first phase of inclusion and cultural integration, 4 weeks of practice traineeship in the company. The specific contents are determined in relation to the fields of study, taking into account the areas of operations provided by the technical and vocational  fields of study,  in order to accredit the learning outcomes officially throughout the education received , consistently with the ECVET procedures. It has been given preference in this regard to partners belonging to ECVET network. The result is that in the validation and acknowledgment of internships will be applied the ECVET procedures, on the basis of specific agreements with partners, so that the learning outcomes can be converted to college credit but also involve the release Europass Mobility Document and Certificate of Competencies. The desired overall impact at the local level, is the strengthening of socio-economic, education and training links among school, business and local authorities (stakeholders), looking for common languages and strategies to increase the dialogue between the school and the world of work. At the regional level, the training of technicians able to be responsive to the dynamics of the work will be added value in response to the policies taken to territory redevelopment and unemployment fight. The project has therefore involved in the partnership local authorities, companies and representatives of the social and trade association and partners, interested in the dissemination of the experience too.

The project THREE is addressed to 120 students of an network of 4 Secondary schools situated in the area called “Bassa Padovana, in the Venetian Region.
These technical and vocational schools have a wide and articulated educational offer, where professional profiles have been identified to include in the project as they are coherent with the project reference themes.
The project is aimed at 4th  and 5th year students (that is the final cycle of studies of upper secondary education) and the mobility will start from May 2015, and will last five weeks.
The vocational reference field is tourism with a particular attention towards the agro-food and services, including those aimed at care and wellness of the person, whose macro area includes marketing and administration functions and the integration of cross-curricular competences in the linguistic field as well as in the management of territory.
The reference contexts are characterized by the economy affected by the strong impact of economic and financial crisis in terms of decrease in jobs.
At the same time, the statistic surveys highlight the difficulty to modify behaviours and organization models by small companies, due to historic and cultural conditioning which are very rooted and that limit the necessary innovation processes with the persistence of  genre and ethnic stereotypes.
In this context, one of the project goals is to enhance the relationships with “the other”, either at genre, at cultural or origin level, helping the young to feel the difference as a resource and not only as a limit.
A mature and open approach towards intercultural differences together with the development of the concept of the company social responsibility, is one of the key elements to trigger revitalization  processes et new employments creation on a new ground closely linked to the territory potentialities. 
On the professional level the goals of the project concern the reinforcement of the knowledge of foreign languages, linked, above all, to the language for special purposes of the different reference contexts and the growth of knowledge and technical competences that are a spur also for new work organization models .  
The young will experience abroad  the contact with different cultures that let them start synergies and  cooperation processes and  acquire innovative organizational models at social content, to recreate the operational context of reference. 
The learning outcomes in terms of acquired competences will be assessed and validated by applying  the ECVET procedures to make them  recognition .
The work experience is integrated in the school educational curriculum and it is recognised as a compulsory training within the dual school-work scheme.
The internships will take place in companies operating in the specific professional fields in Austria, France, UK, Ireland,  Spain.
The quantitative, qualitative and  methodological results of the project will be shared among the participants partners of the network, during all the period of the project by using the web and IT tools and they will be presented during a final seminar to local institutions and to companies of the territory , and at the same  time Europass Mobility will be given to the participants.

The project ‘Con l’Europa verso il futuro’ involves 110 students at the end of their penultimate year of study before graduation. The sending network consists of four High School Educational Institutes located in central Sicily, in an area suffering from a socio-economic point of view and penalized by the lack of roads and by the territorial isolation. 

Students are drawn from a wide variety of courses: Vocational for the Agricultural and Rural Development and the Gastronomy and hotel hospitality, Economics International Relations for Marketing. Potentially they are profiles suitable to contribute to an integrated development model that relates and bring out the excellence in the area. But at present they do not provide many opportunities to access to a qualified profession and a stable outlook. Moreover a significant percentage of students is exposed to school failure, school dropout and dispersion. Considered these economic and social difficulties this project focuses on three main objectives :

-The development of technological and digital skills to invest in an economy based on knowledge- tools.

-To recognize the importance of communicative skills in Community languages to enhance the international competitiveness and the attractiveness of local

products.

-The growth of professional and technological skills, promoting a spirit of enterprise that operates in synergy with local realities.

In terms of method, Con l’Europa is an integrated training project divided into learning units that develops according to the rules of the alternation between

school learning and training in work context.

Starting in June 2015 the stay abroad includes a first week of preparation for the linguistic and social placement and four weeks of work experience  to be

carried out in groups composed of several professional profiles. Many of the Host organisations are part of the partnership network created during the previous cooperation with the sending Institutes. 

Destination countries will be United Kingdom, France, Spain and Malta, that are more suitable as to the needs of linguistic and professional analysis for the most studied languages as multicultural stimulus and as a way to develop IT skills. 

The choice of the destination has considered the opportunity of direct flights from Sicily.

This project involves the evaluation of the activities carried out by the participants during the work experience in order to recognize the results according

to qualitative and quantitative indicators, with regard to ECVET system. Finally based on the same evidence the Europass Mobility Document will be prepared and issued to the participants.
Coach to Coach: confronto e scambio di pratiche nell'accompagnamento di percorsi di apprendimento internazionali

Within the Coach to Coach project, 40 participants belonging to the following professional qualifications, will be actively involved: a) information officer, coaching  and tutoring of educational paths, guidance and support for job placement; b) technician in elaborating  training needs analysis, the design of training and preparation of accompanying measures ; c) Technician in elaborating individual needs  analysis, providing advice and guidance for the development of the training / work experiences and the validation of experience (EQF level. All participants will have a University degree (6 EQF), necessary to perform the role of designer of educational paths, tutor, trainer, career guidance expert, expert on skills assessment and certification, expert on learning processes in the non-formal sector locally and internationally. Participants will be identified by Accademia europea di Firenze in collaboration with local partners. Participants will benefit from a comparison of experiences and exchange of practices in the field of planning, management and coaching  of non formal learning paths with a local or an international scope. 

The shared need of the partner organisations is to share and discuss concretely on methodologies  design, to monitor and tutor, accompany the local and international activities, learning to recognize and implement "transparency" tools using ECVET, exchange practices and tools to improve the quality and the efficacy of the local services, to influence in a bottom up approach, the training, labor and career guidance policies at local, regional and European level. 

The specific needs for the foreseen target group are: to update professional competences in relation to practices and procedures to be used in own field of action; to be part of a lifelong  learning process, testing and improving key competences such as learning to learn and also life skills as working in multicultural contexts and in international teams; experiment and improve own communicative and linguistic competences; feel part of a community and of a network. 

The main project objectives are: create opportunities for exchange practices and experiences in order to circulate know how, practices and methodologies. This experience should serve to improve daily work and to develop new ideas and future cooperation, to reinforce the local and international network, capitalizing and developing experiences and consolidated relationships, throughout the “valorization” platform (see. Dissemination paragraph); to start up a synergic mechanism with all the partners to create international and innovative training paths in coherence with the EU laws; to influence the training, labor and career guidance local, regional and EU policies. 

The main learning outcomes expected for the participants are:  to know the International partner activities, to participate to some activities, acting within the International organisation itself; to know the local network with whom the international partner co-operates;  research and share practices in line with own professional profile and qualification and also in line with the individual learning agreement; experiment own linguistic and cultural competences; to improve own life skills.

The expected results for all partners are: to improve practices and tools in the project areas; to improve the quality of all local services for individuals; to recognize, certify and validate experiences and learning processes and outcomes; to have an impact on policies and their modernization. 

The expected learning outcomes for participants are: improvement or consolidation of life skills, key competence learning to learn, professional competences related to the profiles and qualifications.  It is also expected that – in a medium time – they could bring changes and improvement in their own professional contexts.

In a long perspective, it is foreseen that they could stimulate a quality culture of mobility, networking to improve the quality of all services, improvement and simplification of all procedures for competences certification, recognition and validation at European level.

Working methodologies will be grounded on active participation of all project actors, on the principle of co-responsibility already defined in the project design phase. Mobilities will be managed using active and participative methodologies: participants will be responsible for own learning and they will undertake an active learning paths, reflecting on their professional role and qualification.

As for the tools, the project foresees to active online procedures and tools in order to facilitate the communication and the participation of all actors.

Coach to coach project foresees mobilities which will last 1 week, in the following partner countries: ES, PT,UK, CY, FR, MT, SI, DE, CZ. The project will be run during 2 years time from 1st November 2014 until the 1st of November 2016.

The proposal is devoted to 40 students coming from the Einaudi - Checcher School, specifically belonging to the 4th year of studies. In the way of going on according with the dual system (study and placement), the project has the aim of increasing abilities in order to afford the job markets enquiries and gain maturity and self indipendence in choosing better solution for studies and jobs.
Needs of participants are mainly:
-acquire and improve linguistic skills
-improve key competences
-improve and development job skills
-be competitive and prepared to enter into the job market at the end of the studies
Aims of the project for the participants are:
-a development as individuals and professionals
-acquire a good level of independence
-self critic power
-a good level of autonomy in the daily life.
Aim of the promoter is:
-develop its vocational training offer 
-enforce skills and abilities of the students
-offer innovative and quality trainings
Aim of the project intermediate partners is:
-develop networks in order to implement mobility projects
-increase the quality in school system and in enterprises 
Attended results by the project in total:
-participants acquire more in terms of key competences and professional skills in the way they can more easily enter the job market, with right qualifications, high motivation and high self consideration
-local enterprise improve quality of their services, giving place to new profiles, prepared and qualified
-international partners and sending partner improve educational methods and instruments, together with POF, focusing on dual system of education (theory-practise, classroom and placement).
The project intends to offer a mobility opportunity  to 40 students from the 4th year of study and are attending the following fields of study : service workers for the tourist trade, technical services for the food, wine and hospitality hotel ; experts of business information systems , sector administration, finance and marketing , technical services business . 
The paths of mobility will be divided into two macroflows of 20 participants each to be held in June 2015 and 2016 in Spain, Ireland, France and Malta. 
The project will have an impact at local and international level, not only in terms of expected outcomes, but also through dissemination actions that will be carried out by the promoter and partners.

Coop4Live  - Training, Human Resource, European Education

The Coop4Live project, promoted by the 'ISIS' Brignoli - Einaudi - Marconi (located in Gradisca d'Isonzo – Staranzano), involves a new net of interprovincial schools of Friuli Venezia Giulia, with a view to regular cooperation during the next  seven years. 

The themes of the project will focus on a) learning, discussion and development of business, social, cooperative ideas, b) the Integrated Tourism Value Chain activities from different professional and attentive to sustainability, protection and enhancement of the territory, receptivity.

Over against the sixth consecutive year of crisis for the national economy, a particular Region for history, geography and politics as the Friuli Venezia Giulia is wondering about the need to adopt new business models that combine economy and business ethics with a view to long-term development of the area, so to reinforce values such as cooperation, social inclusion, the virtuous use of financial resources to enhance the collective well-being. At regional political level, we have witnessed the development of the tourism sector, combining it with a new conception of the territory and its environmental protection, urban regeneration and environmental improvements looking at green-topics, energy-saving and green building.

The project Coop4Live, through the experience of five weeks abroad during the summer of 2015, wants to take up the challenge to which the idea to network and create business with an ethical perspective (cooperative, social, inclusive and innovative), beyond the mere exploitation of time and resources, can be a key factor in rebuilding the local and national economy.



The participants will be 110 students from 4th and 5th classes, cming from  a network of inter-province (Gorizia, Pordenone, Trieste) high schools that for the first time have formed a partnership. Students come from a) Economic sectors b) Technological Sectors c) Services Sectors. Sectors and their  fields of study were chosen looking at complementary needs of Integrated Value Chain and taking into account the need to explore new ethic and cooperative business models and ethics in which value team different skills and professionalism. These schools manage the School-Work Alternance: the students attend a path training that involves the integration between theoretical / practical teachings and work experiences in companies. The need is to boost employment through a new model of sustainable development, starting from the touristic declination  and environment offer and protection .

The selected countries are UK, Ireland, France, Spain. The cooperation takes place mostly with members of the ECVET network with solid experience of implementation of training programmes and procedures that will enable the sending institution  the recognition of learning outcomes. In the validation and recognition of work experience, ECVET procedures will be applied on the basis of specific agreements with partners, so that the learning outcomes can be recognized and  Europass Mobility Document and Certificate of Competence will be released to participants.

The network has the support of a significant domestic partnership consisting of cooperatives, local authorities,  companies and representatives of the social partners and economic bodies, evidence of interest in the topics and of the roots of the schools in the area.

"Health care professionals mobility – VET" is an innovative and experimental project based on the theme of social professions. The target group consists of twelve young recent graduates, aged between 22 and 30 years, who have successfully completed, at an accredited VET school, a training program aimed at achieving the qualification of “Socio-healthcare operator” or “Social-care Operator” and intend, therefore, carry out an internship abroad within a year of their qualification.

They are "skilled professions in the health and social services" (Isfol-Istat). The transnational partnership is composed by three partner countries, Spain, France and Ireland; there are three sending groups for four students lasting 10 weeks. Considering the high demand for employment of these operators, the project intends to work on the strong differential between the skills provided by the average training courses financed by at regional o private level and the skills requests from companies willing to take on, bridging the gap between the expected and actual occupational profiles and contributing, through the experience abroad, to identify the skills that increase their productivity.

The project objective is, then, to address two matters: the need to create new opportunities for advanced training especially for segments of the population at greatest risk of long-term unemployment and social exclusion and the will to build a quality training model in a field with one of the highest employment potential as possible in Sicily.

The project provides a work-training programme: the training time starts before the departure with the cultural and pedagogical preparation, orientation and introduction to the experience to promote a previous knowledge on the destination country and type of work. The insertion will take place at health care facilities (such as private hospitals) and social structures (day care centers, nursing homes, home care, recovery community, group homes, residential communities). 

The project provides for constant monitoring and mentoring of students by staff specially dedicated by the host institutions and intermediaries. Each institution involved has participated from the beginning to the creation of a shared proposal in which were divided and identified the roles of each member for every operational phase. The signing of the "Commitment to quality partnership," the "Agreement of Mobility-Learning - ECVET" and the "Memorandum of Understanding" will be the operative instrument.

The project is preordained to achieving results related directly to participants and others in the partnership. The learner will increase his previous professional and transversal skills comparing with different work situations and will be encouraged and facilitated in its "competitiveness working " at European level recognized by the validation of the training and professional path through the validation device ECVET in its report to the EQF.

The applicant will start a network with organizations working in the field of mobility and the implementation of a dynamic group of associations and companies operating in Sicily. For all the partnership: improving standards of quality and reliability in the management of professional internships. Overall, it will respond to the need repeatedly denounced by health care providers to improve the quality and comprehensibility of skills. The project as a whole encourages active policies to promote the employability of young people especially in regions with high unemployment such as Sicily, in particular, in the area of ​​health care where there is a greater job opportunities. It will help in the long run, compared to the Europe 2020 priorities for the education system, to making lifelong learning and mobility a reality in the field of project workable, creating a more inclusive system of education, promoting gender equality, social cohesion and active citizenship as well as contribute to a strengthening of the stakeholders in the process of cooperation at EU level.
Prácticas en Europa Erasmus +, fp grado medio, FCT y titulados.

We are requesting 14 mobilities for students and graduates of  IVT training degrees  involved in the families of administration, electricity and IT of our institute , they will complete their FCT period or they will do an internships as graduates in companies of UK, France and Italy
  
MOBILITIES QUALITY :
  
Always there will be only one participant in each company except in the case of students in the electricity companies, they have enough workload and the tutor 's ability to accommodate two students.
  
We have enough partners host  to ensure maximum utilization and improve the integration of the participant in the company and the destination city and to deal with any unforeseen change   that may arise.

We have the experience and infrastructure necessary based on experience from previous years in different European programs to carry out this project , facing any unforeseen problems that might arise during  his development.

  
Applicant Organization : Public IES Alonso de Avellaneda of Alcalá de Henares will manage all aspects of project completely autonomously .
  
Host partners in the UK ( 7) , France (2 ) and Italy ( 1).
  
NEEDS :
 
- Improving training for IVT trainees with the completion of the FCT in European companies.
- Increase the employability of these students and graduates of these degrees.
- To enable participants to learn to work in a European business environment.
- Expand their business horizons , self-sufficiency and ability to work in an international team .
- Improve their professional and linguistic skills.

OBJECTIVES :
- Increase the possibility of  mobility of  IVT students.
- Raising the quality of the FCT .
- Improving the employability of these students and recent graduates .
- Learn new techniques used by European companies in each of the specialties.
- To facilitate this learning experience to people who otherwise would have no chance , promoting equal opportunities for different types of students.
- Increasing the prestige of the IVT and interest of the general population in order to follow these studies.
- Promote the use of  IT's in IVT and teaching "on line"
- Encourage the use of our virtual platform through internet based Moodle "Prácticas en Europa Erasmus +, fp grado medio FCT y titulados"
- Expand our network of companies and partners  

RESULTS : Increasing interest in studying an IVT degree ,learning languages in order to do  FCT's in another country, or doing an internship  as graduates, increasing their motivation , improving the social image of the IVT
  
WHERE : 
Participants will do the internship in companies in the UK, France and Italy
  
WHEN:
- 11 weeks during the regular period of the FCT's : From March to June 2015 for the trainees of Administration, Electricity and IT degrees.
- To graduates will also be 11 weeks , the dates between January and April 2015.

We ask two training mobilities of staff, one for UK and one for France, will be prepared and planned carefully with the help of our partners to make them as profitable as possible, for IVT teachers into the  IT, electrical and administration degrees. We expect that these training visits allow to the teachers  learn about processes and activities carried out in European companies and that can be incorporated into teaching for our students, this will  improve their acquired knowledge and skills. The diffusion of personal mobility activities will contribute further to give our most prestigious institution and attractive to students interested in studying IVT in our school.
The staff mobilities will be carried out one of the October weeks of 2014.
Acciones de movilidad para el desarrollo de habilidades y la promoción de la competitividad y la creatividad de la industria Hostelera y el turismo

One of the central ideas underlying European Lifelong Learning policies is that international mobility should become a natural part of education and training schemes. This helps learners to achieve higher qualification levels which are crucial for a successful first step into the labour market or for career improvements. The EU Member States are fully committed to helping young people take advantage of the opportunities open to them in terms of learning mobility. Young people participating in VET schemes are a particular focus of this commitment, and the Member States recently set a target of enabling 6% of all learners in initial VET to have completed a period of VET study abroad by 2020. In line with these objectives and European policies, through this project, the VET school(Escuela Profesional de Hosteleria de Jerez) aim to improve the quality of education and vocational training, giving a European dimension to the learning paths and thus providing the young participants the opportunity to test and improve their skills: professionalism in the specific areas of vocational education (hospitality, tourism promotion and management), cultural knowledge and linguistic preparation. This general objective, in line with the ET2020 strategy is pursued through a mobility experience that consists of a learning mobility internship abroad of 4 weeks for Level 1 students/ and a 3-month internship for 60 recent graduates from the Level 2 and 3 . The training programme includes an internship in selected companies in the sector of Hospitality industries and tourism, to acquire knowledge and skills within the sectors and compare the various professional techniques, and activities aimed at the inclusion and integration in the context and for the improvement of language skills and to better know the culture of the hosting country. The main expected results from the project include: the rise of the personal and professional skills of the students, and the promotion of key competencies related to the real exercise of active citizenship; increasing the employment potential of the participants, the introduction of innovative training methods as a complement to existing practices and pathways and the improvement of the educational level of technical and vocational schools, the development of relations between the transnational partners and the promotion of processes of cooperation and exchange of good practices between the partners involved, with a significant impact in improving the educational and vocational guidance.

The construction of a permanent network of transnational public-institutional organisations and not only, therefore, is one of the main objectives of the project and allows the exchange of experiences and best practices at various levels (technical excellence, best practices in educational policies and governance of the system). The Consortium, with this proposal, therefore, aims to give momentum to the internationalization of institutional relations and cooperation at European level. The opportunities for economic and social growth cannot be separated from the desire to create strong interdependence and synergy between educational and training institutions and strong partnerships with local and foreign business realities.

The project is, besides, implemented in an European context considering the European priority and thematic approached such as "ECVET for transparency and recognition of learning outcomes and qualifications". The development of ECVET began in 2002 after the Copenhagen Process emphasizing the need for a credit transfer system for VET. CrossCompetence is a project based on the concrete responses to the questions of developing ECVET in the European member States and corresponding to the 2009 EU Recommendations on the establishment of the European Credit system for VET. The project works in particular to realise an European area for Lifelong Learning in the field of cultural industries and the promotion and management of tourism.

The whole activities are implemented by regarding a strong European perspective which are reflected in all project activities and results. The project aims to increase the knowledge of ECVET and its technical specifications and ensuring that the added value of ECVET is understood and perceived all over Europe.

The ERASMUSCORES project is promoted by the society of regional development "Alcores Development, sl" which is an instrumental body of the municipalities of Carmona, Viso del Alcor and Mairena del Alcor, which from 1993 decided to join forces to apply for programs and projects related to the improvement of living and working conditions of their towns.



Throughout this report we will try to reflect upon how improving the mobility of young graduates is consistent with the strategy which they are seeking to establish in the region. In fact, it will become an unmet need of the population which increasingly requires the use of the necessary language skills in order to do their job, for which we consider the ERASMUS + program more than effective, raising the question to the category of "CORE VALUE ", hence the name "ERASMUSCORES".



Specifically, the project will be coordinated by the office of Carmona Alcores Development (consortium coordinator), since it is in this town where the headquarters of the Institutes with professional training certificate cycles which are capable of granting professional certificates to students once they attend the appropriate training cycles, are located. Specifically, the Institutes participating in the project are: IES Arrabal de Carmona, IES Maese Rodrigo, xxx.



Another partner organisation of the Consortium will be the Local Autonomous Municipal Centre Organisation of Comprehensive Training of the town of Carmona, which awards professional certificates for Training Courses by the official approval of the Town Council of Andalusia which awards certificates for the training which it gives: Public Health service to people dependent on social institutions and Public Health service to people living at home, as well the Tourism Module of the Employment Workshop.



Taking into account the sending partners that make up the consortium, the project areas are as follows: the primary sector, the food and agriculture industry, the hotel and tourism sector, handicrafts and services to the community and home sector.



ERASMUSCORES is aimed at 45 young people between 10 and 30 years old who are attending any of the training programs offered by these training centers. To determine the number of participants, Juan Jose Saucedo, director of the Foundation and the signatory of this proposal, has organized meetings with the management team and students of different schools to find out the number of people interested in the mobility experience.



These 45 young people will have the opportunity to have a 9 month long mobility experience in quality companies in one of the countries selected. This will not only be a professional experience, but it will be a life experience which will enable young people to develop competencies and new social skills.



To support the project consortium in the organization and monitoring of placements in the destination countries, they will collaborate with intermediary members, who have extensive experience in working with these types of participants: EUROYOUTH, Lisbon (Portugal) , PARTNERSHIP EUROPE, Cork (Ireland), AEF, Florence (Italy), AMADEUS, Vienna (Austria), VUSTE, Prague (Czech Republic), BONUM, Krakow (Poland), Foyle, Derry (United Kingdom).



Furthermore, both the coordinator (Training) and the OAL are going to make available to the participants the industrial estates which are located in Carmona, El Viso del Alcor and Mairena del Alcor: the Pilero Industrial Park and Industrial Estate Brenes and Logistics Park in Carmona, Poliviso and Santa Isabel in the second municipality and Gandúl and Trocha in Mairena del Alcor.



ERASMUSCORES will use a comprehensive method of monitoring all activities of the project in all its phases, and it will evaluate all interested parties as detailed throughout the report.



As for the duration, desirably the project will last the maximum amount of time permitted by the limitations of the call. In order for participants to return before the full 12 months away from their degrees, the mobility experience will not be able to last longer than 9 months. We consider this the optimal duration for a true professional experience in which the participant can acquire all the professional and personal skills which enable the achievement of the fundamental objective of the project: improving the employability and quality of life of young people.

Our project is intended to 11th and 12th grade female students from Uydukent Kız Teknik ve Meslek Lisesi, Zübeyde Hanım Kız Teknik ve Meslek Lisesi ve Sandıklı Kız Teknik ve Meslek Lisesi. From our school’s Information Technologies field 8, from Beauty and Hair Care field 8, from Child Development field 8; from Sandıklı Kız Teknik ve Meslek Lisesi Information Technologies and Child Development fields 8 each, from Zübeyde Hanım Kız Teknik ve Meslek Lisesi Beauty and Hair Care 8;  total 48 female students will be accompanied by 3 teachers from our school and 2 teachers from Sandıklı Kız Teknik ve Meslek Lisesi and 1 teacher from Zübeyde Hanım Kız Teknik ve Meslek Lisesi.

 

Our topics in the project content have been covering the areas that mainly women are employed. Potential business fields for our students graduating from Information Technologies field; computer technical service, companies/institutions giving maintenance and repair services. For students graduating from Child Development and Education; nursery, slots, kindergarten, preschool, rehabilitation centers and children clubs. Beauty and Hair Care graduations; can take part in beauty salons and institutes, skin care centers, hairdressers, hotels, theatre and television studios and similar businesses.

 

Recently became widespread “Qualified Intermediary Employee” expression, has become the agenda of educational institutions. Even thought our students are given theoretical and practical training to bring qualified intermediary employee features in their field, employment qualification competence is developing day by day in the market conditions. Our project is to head towards areas where women employment is concentrated due to our female students take place in disadvantaged groups in employment. In order to reach increased criteria in employment, our participants have to increase their experience and skills.

 

According to regional plan covering Afyonkarahisar, Kütahya, Manisa and Uşak provinces prepared by T.C. Zafer Kalkınma Ajansı (Development Agency) under the vision of “In development considering ecological balance that increases competiveness, produces added value, accelerates the process of development with knowledge based economy, has high self-confidence and quality of life, being a developing and learning region” between the years 2010-2014 financial and technical support programs are carried out. Thus, as a result of the investments made in our province, it is expected to expand employment opportunities. Considering that our project topics within knowledge based and producing added value sectors, Development Agency’s investments will reflect positively. Hence, workforce needed regarding with our fields, poses a situation in favor of our participants depending on the potential of our province and neighboring provinces. However, our participants is required to gain professional competence for employment. In the service sector, the importance of skilled and well trained staff is determining factor for employment. Providing the possibility of overseas internship with EU Lifelong Learning Program, our project will raise awareness for the needed professional, personal, cultural and linguistic development and will also contribute to our female students for being employed. Moreover, they will have the opportunity to make comparisons with our country by joining the European vocational training practices in place. As a result of that, it is expected occur that our students will create efforts to increase professional and personal development.

 

Activity actions;

In the field of Information Technology between 09-02/22-02-2015 with 16 participants to United Kingdom,

In the field of Child Development and Education between 09-03/22-03-2015 with 16 participants to Macedonia,

In the field of Beauty and Hair Care Services between 06-04/19-04-2015 with 16 participants will take place in Lithuania.

For each activity action 2 teachers, total 6 attendant teachers will participate.

This submission to the second VET call within the UK for mobilities is to complement an earlier successful application and wider the curriculum areas that staff development opportunities are available for.  The activities of this project will be delivered in conjunction with Omina, our Finish partner, with which we have had previous involvement with.  They are the Joint Authority of Education in Espoo Region, and are a multisectoral educational organisation owned by municipalities of Espoo, Kauniaianen and Kirkkonummi.

The activity consists of 3 flows, each for two staff, to train within the Early Years context in Finland.  Scandinavian countries are often famed for spending more time in the outdoors in all weathers, integrating learning and development between indoor activities and outdoor activities.  In addition to this the Finish education system has been ranked as one of the best in the world.  The three flows of staff exchanges proposed in this application would allow staff the opportunity to job shadowing and observe the early years environment and understand how the system used in the Forest School environment differ from our own context in the United Kingdom.

These initial staff training opportunities would form the basis of knowledge that would better inform new and innovative approaches to the development of curriculum in our College.  Noticeable differences that would be important to review include the option to continue pre-schooling to the age of 7, less testing at earlier ages, lower levels of Government/Local Authority measurement and control, learning through more integration in outdoor experiences that include more child-initiated activities and less staff-initiated activities.  A particular focus would be with regard to new developments in preschool/ primary curriculum  literacy and numeracy in Finland.

This activity would be seen as a first step in a longer term partnership that would allow the progression of student exchanges and sustainable partnership opportunities on curriculum development and training that would be extended to other mutual partners of both parties to this activity.
Higher education student and staff mobility project
This is a higher education student and staff mobility project, please consult the website of the organisation to obtain additional details.
Educare gli adulti tra Arte e Cultura

Born in Arezzo, thanks to the background and the skills of its members, SEME was able to assert its identity as a cultural joining space, recognized both locally and internationally.
With the aim to carry on and to enhance this evolutionary path, SEME identified the partners selected for artistic and structural  affinities.
This project is meant to observe, test and transfer the best practices identified at European level relating to the implementation of actions, activities, cultural and artistic events in the local area and become a privileged point of reference in the field of performing arts at European and international level.
The project participants will be five people belonging to the staff of SEME. Their background is in arts and in management in the cultural sector.
The planned activities  are job shadowing - which will be built in Hungary, Northern Ireland, Germany and Spain - and the realization of teaching assignments required by the Northern Ireland, Spanish and Hungarian partners.
The methodology will be practical and interactive observation of the activities carried out by selected partners followed by plenary discussions on collaborative possibilities emerged during the stays abroad.
The expected result is related to the transfer of knowledge and practices to educate adults in artistic and cultural field.
The whole organization is expected to become aware of new methods and techniques for managing groups of adults and new methods of organizing events and strategic communication in order to re-use and take advantage of the experience.
The potential long-term benefits are related to the possibility of becoming an important hub in the flowand in the enjoyment of cultural and artistic contents, to continue to cooperate with foreign partners through projects, creating networks and laying the groundwork for an effective and concrete application of the tools / methods (artistic, innovative teaching and learning, etc.). shared during activities abroad.

"My career, my decision" is a youth exchange bringing together young people and youth leaders from Slovenia, Northern Ireland and Germany that are eager to learn about each others cultures and everyday lives and at the same time gain some new skills that will make them more employable. The exchange will take place in August 2014 in Slovenia and will use non formal learning methods (social and team building games, role playing, world cafe, etc.) to discover who we are and were are we going with our career paths.

Most youth today are enthusiastic users and consumers of information technology. They hardly remember a time when there was no Internet, e-mail, mobile phones, or digital media. Our objective in the project is to encourage and enthuse young people, with Science, Technology, Engineering and Maths, (STEM) using an established and proven non-formal eduction method - "RoboParty", that emphasises active problem-solving with intelligent technology to put youth in the role of creating and designing with  technology—not just using and consuming it.



RoboParty is an event where teams of young people learn skills and experiences by building a robot and in turn programming it to compete in inter-team competitions.  This RoboParty takes place annually at the University of Minoh, Guimaraes - Portugal, where 17 youth, from disadvantaged backgrounds, will travel from Northern Ireland to attend this event. 



A key objective of the Programme for Government 2011-15 authored by the Northern Ireland Executive states that they would like to " increase uptake in economically relevant Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) places" within the local education and training system.  Through this project, by attracting youth in a non-formal education scenario, this can start to be achieved at the grass roots level and act as a catalyst to attract youth to a career path or education path in STEM subjects. 



As a long term goal is it proposed that the RoboParty is exported from Portugal for the first time and run in our college so that a wider range of youth within the region can participate and gain from the skills and experiences afforded to these 17 youth participants.

The project originated after REACH Across issued a partner request seeking a youth organisation of a similar age group and with similar activities/programmes. Both groups have provided wide-ranging international projects for many years and wanted to establish a new project with a new partner group. 
The project will take place over 10 days in Derry, Northern Ireland and will be the first part of a bilateral youth exchange involving young people from Derry in N. Ireland and  Varna in Bulgaria. Each group will include 12 young people and 2 leaders. 
The primary themes are to foster mutual understanding between young people in different countries, especially countries emerging from conflict and to promote European cooperation in the youth field. The project aims to increase the awareness of participants in relation to cultural traditions, society and youth-related issues in other European countries. It will have a wide ranging content so as to promote inclusion, personal learning and life enhancing experiences. It will also encourage participants to understand the social consequences of our recent conflicts and to make recommendations for Shared Futures on a local and European basis. The project will encourage participants to be more active, healthier and respectful citizens and to develop personal skills, confidence levels and social input, that will have a positive impact on their communities.
The project will be a combination of educational visits, development workshops, outdoor activities and groupwork sessions. It will also aim to give participants an insight into the benefits of European co-operation and to establish a working partnership for future projects.
The project will promote healthy lifestyles, through outdoor activities and several sports, as an additional means of fostering social inclusion and active participation.

The project originated after REACH Across issued a partner request seeking a youth organisation of a similar age group and with similar activities/programmes. The youth organization at Association Narodno Chitalishte “N.V.Rakitin” have provided wide-ranging international projects and wanted to establish a new project with a new partner group. 
The project will take place over 10 days in Bulgaria and will be the second part of a bilateral youth exchange involving young people from Derry in N. Ireland and from Trudovets. Each group will include 12 young people and 2 leaders. 
The primary themes are to foster mutual understanding between young people in different countries, especially countries emerging from conflict and to promote European cooperation in the youth field.

The project aims to increase the awareness of participants in relation to cultural traditions, environment and human rights and youth-related issues in other European countries. The activities will have a wide ranging content so as to promote inclusion, personal learning and life enhancing experiences for discussing current issues via debate workshop. 

It will also encourage participants to understand the social consequences of our recent conflicts and to make recommendations for Shared Futures on a local and European basis. The project will encourage participants to be more active, healthier and respectful citizens and to develop personal skills, confidence levels, volunteer activities and social input, that will have a positive impact on their communities.

The project will be a combination of educational visits, development workshops, outdoor activities and groupwork . It will aim to give participants an insight into the benefits of European co-operation and to establish a working partnership for future projects.
The project will promote healthy lifestyles, through outdoor activities and sports, as an additional means of fostering social inclusion and active participation.

The International Circus Games Exchange is a project geared towards the professional development of youth workers through expanding their ability to use certain kinds of physical games as a means of connection with youth.
The most important aspect in youth work is being able to connect with the youth at hand. Once that connection is established, we are able to help the youth prepare for a sea of confronting situations and challenges they will encounter during their lives.
Youth workers use a variety of different techniques in order to form connections with youth. Through games, youth workers are able to lay strong foundations of trust and openness with the youth with whom they work. We believe games not only provide a safe social environment for personal development, but also improve competencies  and fundamentals youth need to establish themselves well within a community. We believe that certain types of physical games have an educational value that is yet to be fully explored in our education systems. When it comes to the personal development of youth, games are more than a way of having fun, they are important to our organisations and are an extremely powerful learning tool especially when used in a social context.

The games exchange will provide a sharing platform for physical games and how they are used in youth work amongst circus schools and other organisations who promote non-formal learning and art education. 
It will take place from 03/05/2015 - 07/05/2015 and will be hosted by Cirkus In Beweging in Leuven, Belgium.
Originally stemming from a spontaneous games exchange workshop during the NICE (Network for International Circus Exchange) meeting in Denmark in 2013, the International Circus Games Exchange had instant partners and support through youth circus schools and other organisations across Europe.
In this project we will bring together a strong knowledge base from different countries, cultures and organisations.
The project will be focussed on the exchange of this knowledge between partner organisations and the individuals representing them. 
We will investigate the different kinds of games used by our organisations and for what purposes.  Time will be spent on different categories of games such as Ice-Breakers, physical warm-up games, group connection games, energising and de-energising games, team building games, cooperation games, character based games, building games, creative thinking games, social inclusion games, improvisation games and others.
There will be a specific focus on learning new games from other organisations and cultures as well as offering variations on games that are already known. With the expertise of the partners and the participants representing them, time will also be spent on improving and customising games to cater for specific purposes.
Cirkus In Beweging will be partnered by Youth Circus Schools and other organisations throughout Europe who promote non-formal learning. Each organisation will send two or three "Games Experts" who have a strong knowledge of games used in their organisations. This expertise will be shared with and transferred to the other participants through explanation and physical demonstration in an open sharing space setting, this means that everyone will be free to give feedback, to propose variations and also have the opportunity to help customise the games to suit other purposes.

Each participant will return to their organisation with a larger and stronger knowledge and database of games. They will have a greater knowledge and awareness of different types of games and also variations on games they already know.  Participants will have been exposed to the purposes for which other organisations and participants use games. The individuals will have had the experience of being a key role in developing and customising games to suit a specific purpose/need and will now be more adept in doing so in the future. The participants will return with a better awareness of games played in other countries and in other cultures.

The desired impact of the project is to share knowledge on a European, international and intercultural level. 
The project will help strengthen bonds between partnering organisations and countries and help to form long lasting partnerships between partner organisations. The project will create a better awareness of the philosophies of the different partner organisations and countries. This project will also serve as a basis for this type of exchange and hopefully promote further Games Exchange possibilities and partnerships in the future.

The "Embrace Equality" project is the subject of international youth exchange to be held in Portugal in July 2015. It’s the result from the cooperation of four European institutions that develop its work in the area of intervention with youth: Santa Casa da Misericórdia de Lisboa - Portugal, Helsingin Kaupunkin - Finland, Movego Jugendhilfe Gemeinnützige GmbH - Germany and the Dove House Community Trust - Ireland.
This project represents a continuation of the work that begun in 2010 that allowed the realization of three exchanges involving more than 90 youngsters, 15 group leaders and organizations from 5 countries.
This year the youngsters elected as themes to work: inclusion and equality. It has been proposed as work targets, issues of inclusion in different countries, acknowledge of practices generating equality, to reflect and identify key factors involved in the generation of cycles of exclusion and ways to break them. Other objectives are to strengthen international partner network and the promotion of personal and social skills of young people.
The project will feature 40 youngsters from four countries: Portugal, Germany, Finland and Northern Ireland. The youngsters are mostly from multicultural disadvantaged socio-economic contexts in which prevails social maladjustment, ESL, consumption and trafficking of drugs, poverty and social exclusion. 
During the exchange, will be conducted different sociocultural and sports activities, both indoor and outdoor, daily conversations and meetings that allow young people to experience and reflect on the themes.
