XPTO+ V – eXcellence in Professional Training Opportunities V

The project XPTO + V results from the partnership established between EUROYOUTH, the promoter and the schools, sending entities in this project, AE Santo André, EP Fafe, EP Rio Maior and Academia Total - IEDP. for the promotion of the XPTO + consortium.

We defined 5 general objectives:
-To promote employability and the development of specialized and qualified careers of young people in search of the first job
-To promote the formation of more interested citizens and participants in society
-To guarantee the professional update of the teams and the remaining staff of the partners of XPTO +
-Promote the organizational and internationalization development of the XPTO +
-Contribute to the social, cultural and professional development of the members of the consortium, intervening directly for their training and human potential

As in previous years, schools have chosen destinations for the mobility of their participants, and this year introduced activities for curricular traineeships, following the survey of the needs of each of the schools involved and the XPTO + III and IV projects, which already have students. With the intention of promoting inclusion and equal opportunities, it is also the option of the XPTO + V to reserve a minimum of one place per school for students with SEN / proven economic difficulties, in addition to introducing, in the selection process, the increase of 15% for students with these characteristics.

AE SANTO ANDRÉ - 20 Curricular internships 12th year (430h - 98 days), for EL, DE, IT, IE, UK, CY, IT
EP FAFE - 8 Grades 12 th year (370h - 77 days) and 7 recent graduates (98 days), for FR, ES, IT, UK
EP RIO MAIOR - 12 Curricular stages 12th year (360h - 77 days) and 5 recent graduates (98 days), for UK, CZ, FR, DE
IEDP - 20 Internships for newly graduates (98 days), for DE, FR, IE, IT, SE

All schools will also participate in teacher mobilities, sending 2 teachers each to partner schools: EL - 2nd EPAL KARDITSAS, LV - Daugavpils Technical School, IS - Fjölbrautaskóli Suðurnesja, SE - Elof Lindälvs gymnasium.

With regard to the cooperation activities within the consortium, namely the project management and implementation and the management of international partnerships for the implementation of the mobilities, an effective communication system is established, thus, at the level of the consortium, bets on regular meetings throughout the project. There will be at least 4 face-to-face meetings: one for planning, two for follow-up and one for evaluation and closure of the project. At the same time, in the execution and management of the project chain, Skype meetings are promoted with a quarterly regularity.

Of the impacts that we want to guarantee with this project, we highlight:
STUDENTS AND NEW DIPLOMAS
Increasing the employability rate among participants and facilitating the transition to active life
Practical experience in EU companies, complementing theoretical and practical training
Approach to Europe, reinforced by the idea of a European citizen
More students in training mobility duly accredited and certified at national and European level and with international recognition
Self-promotion and affirmation through recognition of their professional and personal skills (Europass Mobility and ECVET)
Soft skills and reinforced social and personal skills

STAFF
Appeal to new techniques and pedagogies
Ability to apply the ECVET certification process
Knowledge of the European labour market
Personal, social and cultural enrichment: to know other lifestyles, cultures, social / professional values
Greater proximity to the international market: domain of languages, knowledge of the sector (innovation, challenges, positioning);
Creation of new individual projects and inserted in the context of the school

Note that this being our fifth project, we have already been able to identify real impacts on the partners that participate in the XPTO + consortium:
Raising the employability / entry rate in higher education in participating groups (EASA)
Improvement in the instruments created for professional and vocational guidance of our students (EP Fafe)
Introduction of new instruments for the monitoring and evaluation of curricular internships in Portugal (EP Rio Maior)
Reduction of school absenteeism and improvement in the use of modules in each discipline (IEDP)
Technical training of EUROYOUTH team, which facilitated the integration of projects in a transnational partnership in the area of evaluation of the ECVET process and the quality and return of the Erasmus + mobility in vocational training (EUROYOUTH)

It is by identifying the impacts that we want to achieve and that we have already achieved that we can affirm that our project is fundamental for all the involved entities. Schools have already stated that individually, they do not have the capacity to propose and execute a project with the same individual dimension (17 to 22 participants per school).

STUDENTS AND NEW DIPLOMAS
Increasing the employability rate among participants and facilitating the transition to active life
Practical experience in EU companies, complementing theoretical and practical training
Approach to Europe, reinforced by the idea of a European citizen
More students in training mobility duly accredited and certified at national and European level and with international recognition
Self-promotion and affirmation through recognition of their professional and personal skills (Europass Mobility and ECVET)
Soft skills and reinforced social and personal skills

STAFF
Appeal to new techniques and pedagogies
Ability to apply the ECVET certification process
Knowledge of the European labour market
Personal, social and cultural enrichment: to know other lifestyles, cultures, social / professional values
Greater proximity to the international market: domain of languages, knowledge of the sector (innovation, challenges, positioning);
Creation of new individual projects and inserted in the context of the school

Note that this being our fifth project, we have already been able to identify real impacts on the partners that participate in the XPTO + consortium:
Raising the employability / entry rate in higher education in participating groups (EASA)
Improvement in the instruments created for professional and vocational guidance of our students (EP Fafe)
Introduction of new instruments for the monitoring and evaluation of curricular internships in Portugal (EP Rio Maior)
Reduction of school absenteeism and improvement in the use of modules in each discipline (IEDP)
Technical training of EUROYOUTH team, which facilitated the integration of projects in a transnational partnership in the area of evaluation of the ECVET process and the quality and return of the Erasmus + mobility in vocational training (EUROYOUTH)

It is by identifying the impacts that we want to achieve and that we have already achieved that we can affirm that our project is fundamental for all the involved entities. Schools have already stated that individually, they do not have the capacity to propose and execute a project with the same individual dimension (17 to 22 participants per school).
XPTO+ V – eXcellence in Professional Training Opportunities V

The project XPTO + V results from the partnership established between EUROYOUTH, the promoter and the schools, sending entities in this project, AE Santo André, EP Fafe, EP Rio Maior and Academia Total - IEDP. for the promotion of the XPTO + consortium.

We defined 5 general objectives:
-To promote employability and the development of specialized and qualified careers of young people in search of the first job
-To promote the formation of more interested citizens and participants in society
-To guarantee the professional update of the teams and the remaining staff of the partners of XPTO +
-Promote the organizational and internationalization development of the XPTO +
-Contribute to the social, cultural and professional development of the members of the consortium, intervening directly for their training and human potential

As in previous years, schools have chosen destinations for the mobility of their participants, and this year introduced activities for curricular traineeships, following the survey of the needs of each of the schools involved and the XPTO + III and IV projects, which already have students. With the intention of promoting inclusion and equal opportunities, it is also the option of the XPTO + V to reserve a minimum of one place per school for students with SEN / proven economic difficulties, in addition to introducing, in the selection process, the increase of 15% for students with these characteristics.

EP FAFE - 8 Grades 12 th year (370h - 77 days) and 7 recent graduates (98 days), for FR, ES, IT, UK
EP RIO MAIOR - 12 Curricular stages 12th year (360h - 77 days) and 5 recent graduates (98 days), for UK, CZ, FR, DE
IEDP - 20 Internships for newly graduates (98 days), for DE, FR, IE, IT, SE

With regard to the cooperation activities within the consortium, namely the project management and implementation and the management of international partnerships for the implementation of the mobilities, an effective communication system is established, thus, at the level of the consortium, bets on regular meetings throughout the project. Due to the economical deprivation in Northern Ireland and in the Derry area we strongly feel that the Derry and North West area will benefit from the opportunity of developing further competences, linguistic capabilities and cultural awareness in a global context.  We will work with the North West Regional College, SERC and our European partners to implement the #ETC project which will incorporate ECVET principles to provide a transparency to participants.  This will also allow the learning outcomes and assessments to be recognised and validated within the partnership network and in our local partner networks.
The Northern Ireland Tourist Board has devised a strategy to increase the number of visitors to Northern Ireland.  We feel that the #ETC project will help make recent graduates more employable by providing them with the opportunity to live and work abroad and then bring the skills, innovation and creative ideas they have developed during their training back to Northern Ireland and Derry to improve on the services and products offered to visitors.  
The value in our project comes from the strong network that already exists between Foyle and our partners.  We have all worked in projects, many of us in ECVET projects and are committed to providing quality training mobilities.  
Due to the success of a previous project managed by Foyle the successful employment rate of past participants is 73%.  Particularly in the tourism area and one of our most successful local companies (GoD group) which owns numerous hotels, bars and restaurants, has stated their commitment to offering participants possible employment as they see the cultural and professional benefits of these European mobilities to their businesses.
We plan to send 60 learners/recent graduates connected with the tourism and hospitality fields to carry out a detailed programme which will allow them to develop professional and technical knowledge, skills and techniques.  They will also work towards achieving learning outcomes as agreed with the NWRC and SERC colleges. 
The objectives of our project are:
* To encourage lifelong learning and continuous professional development & for participants to see the benefits of continued training, especially in another European city 
* To help participants progress in their chosen career fields - ultimately helping to make a participant more employable
*  To provide suitable training and to support participants in acquiring new or developing existing knowledge, skills & competences in the field of tourism or hospitality & tourism
*  To bring Europe closer to participants and show the opportunities that exist
*  To develop an awareness, respect and an appreciation for multi-culturalism
*  To promote the learning of a second European language 
*  To develop and strengthen co-operation with our project partners and ensure that all involved are committed to providing quality training, ensuring that participants have a positive experience
* To develop new partnerships and networks- not just for Foyle and its partners but also for the participants and host companies
*  To implement ECVET principles and courses designed for a key action 2 project (VET towards ECVET)as an integral part of the training process and to provide a level of quality assurance using ECVET tools such as MoU, Learning Agreements, Competence Appraisal and Certification to ensure all parties are in agreement and will work towards meeting the projects objectives.   
*  To develop a competence appraisal which will recognise and validate achievement and improved ability obtained during the training period
*  To develop a competence appraisal that will recognise and validate the acquiring and development of skills
*  To award certification and recognition for the meeting of agreed Learning Outcomes.
*  To promote the confidence and levels of self-esteem for participants for future job searches
Ultimately, the main objective  of our #ETC project is for participants to successfully find employment in the local labour market or the European Market.

European Mobility Opportunities to develop Knowledge & Skills

Our project, 'European Mobility Opportunities to develop Knowledge & Skills' (EMOKS) aims to develop the knowledge & skills of current & future learners, in turn helping to improve the economy.
The objectives are: 
• to have better education & teaching in place
• to improve the learning experience 
• to improve retention rates & decrease NEETs
• to create entrepreneurs who will drive the economy 
• to develop collaborative opportunities into high quality research & innovative projects
• to improve the community’s well-being 
• to promote inclusion & equality 

North West Regional College (NWRC) has set out guiding principles relating to the curriculum offered that have been influenced & informed by the NI Programme for Government, and a number of key strategies developed by the Department for the Economy (DfE) & Derry City & Strabane District Council, which all place a strong focus on skills & skills development including;
   
*Further Education Strategy – FE means Success
*Industrial Strategy for NI – Economy 2030
*Economic Inactivity – Enabling Success
*Skills Barometer
*Ireland NorthWest Gateway to Growth
*Strategic Growth Plan

NWRC plays a pivotal role in generating a strong & vibrant economy, underpinning the college’s operational plan is the need to focus on the development of skills with a particular emphasis on competence.  We also support social inclusion through a culture embracing the 3E's framework - Employability, Enrichment & Enterprise by helping those from disadvantaged socio-economic backgrounds to become more economically active. NWRC is a major deliverer of the Government’s apprenticeship & youth training schemes. 

The project activities are included in our application 

* A1 - Advanced Planning Visit - Erasmus-PRO
* A2 - ErasmusPRO long term mobility of VET learners
* A3 - Teaching/training assignments abroad
* A4 - Staff training abroad
* A5 - Short term mobility of VET learner

Project activities fit extremely well into the overall key strategies of the Erasmus+ Programme, NWRC and the wider region; where the focused approach is on better education and development of skills. Erasmus+ priorities have placed a noted emphasis on the delivery of projects that will develop core employability skills and to enhance innovation and the creation of more entrepreneurial individuals. We include targeted curriculum areas including Hairdressing, Early Years, various Training & Craft Skills, Fashion, IT, Hospitality and Essential Skills.  In this application we are introducing new curriculum areas Beauty and Science and we are re-visiting entrepreneurship. 

EMOKS will provide learners the opportunity to undertake a 2 week mobility period in an European country either in a vocational institutes or within a company.  As the project title suggests the learner will gain opportunities to develop their knowledge and skills through training and assessment in their vocational and professional competences and will enhance their employability skills.  

The main development for NWRC in this year's application is the inclusion of ErasmusPRO long term mobilities.  We hope to offer high quality and economically relevant training opportunities to improve the skills level of our students.  The curriculum areas we have selected to pilot this new activity are IT, Creative Industries & Hospitality.  Some of the courses we run in the college in these areas require a compulsory work experience - these can be difficult to secure either through a lack of opportunities in the area or a saturation of the number of placements being sought from companies.  

We include ECVET principles into our mobilities, addressing vocational education with an integrated approach, building on relationships with our partners as we develop learning outcomes that meet our learners’ needs and sharing of experiences.
Learner mobility activities will provide European training experiences to students, many of whom have special needs or fewer opportunities who may not appreciate how adaptable their learning needs are within the context of the wider EU.  The training experience will show them that neither their special needs nor Europe places boundaries on the opportunities that are open to them, in an effort to encourage them to continue with the learning and enhance their employability skills.  

The College development plan seeks to encourage outward mobility.  Learning ouctomes achieved on these projects will benefit the local economy and work towards the strategies set out by our local council for better education and training of its people to compete in global markets. We want the project to focus also on entrepreneurship, participants will be encouraged to develop these skills and use their skills to drive the economy forward.

The large majority of the students that are graduated from a vocational training course have the challenge of finding a job. This Erasmus + challenge often causes uncertainty and confusion for students because they do not know where to find it. This situation is more difficult if they want to find a job in a foreign country. Differences in labour legislation and social security of the European countries are a common obstacle.
Moreover, our academic institution is concerned with corporate social responsibility in business and therefore tries to instill in students values that will contribute, through its work in enterprises, actively and voluntarily to social, economic and environmental improvement.
For this reason, our academic institution raises a transversal project to all professional families that includes several aspects of finding a job within the European Union, differences in labour legislation, social security and values that enable our students to increase their chances of finding a job.
A project will be created through the platform eTwinning with the following title: Welcome to Europe, are you looking for a job? This project will address the different aspects mentioned in the following way:
-  Creating a reference point where all aspects of job search in any countries in Europe are collected.
The main points in this part of the project are: a list of companies where students can direct their job applications, guidelines for the development and creation of the Europass CV, methods to deal with different types of job interviews, both in their mother tongue and in other languages.
The tasks developed are: information and documentation, creation of web space, search and creation of a list of companies, conducting Europass CV, collecting information on job interviews and simulation and, finally, the presentation of these results.
These tasks are intended to provide students with the tools and necessary information to conduct a successful first job search and encourage their employment in the partner countries of the project.
- Highlighting the differences and similarities of the legislation on labour and social security matters among European countries. This is an important issue of concern to workers when considering a European mobility for employment purposes. We will create different teams that will be made up of students from several European academic institutions and they should exchange information regarding contracts, trading systems, payslips, wage and non-wage concepts and payment of contributions.
Conducting training practices in Germany will reveal the aspects worked and transmit them to other students as the key part of the project.
Teachers will explain the project and its goals in two introductory sessions. Several groups are made by members of all participating schools and we schedule the activities, including videoconferencing. Finally, the project findings will be published in eTwinning.
The eTwinning project will culminate with students performing the FCT (workplace training). Their experiences will be transmitted to other students using IT skills or throughout meetings on their return.
The aim of the results of this project has 5 main goals:
- Increasing the number of students in vocational training courses.
- Improving the quality of vocational training courses.
- Improving the International Cooperation and the sense of belonging to the European Union.
- Encouraging students to continue their studies with other vocational training courses (CFGS).
In addition, we will promote the increase of employment opportunities with elements such as mobility, the use of Europass CV or by improving the language skills.

Projection of the vet through European professional internships

The   PROJECTION OF THE VET THROUGH EUROPEAN PROFESSIONAL INTERNSHIPS" project was created in response to the need of vocational schools to provide their students the opportunity to expand and improve the quality of their training practices in European companies. The difficult employment situation in Spain, where youth unemployment rate exceeds 50%, makes it difficult for young people to find their first job: mobility projects facilitate and expand the expectations of entering the labor market.

The project, which lifetime is 12 months,  is designed for 72 students or recent graduates of average degree of professional families 'Administration and Management' (cycle Administrative Management), trade and marketing (cycle T. Commerce) and  authomatic and electrical installations (Electricity and Electronics cycle) that will have a trainingship of one month that will allow them to, in the case of students, integrate into their training cycle practices undertaken as part of the module "Training Centers Work "(FCT). The workplacements will be held in Italy, Ireland, Malta,France and Portugal. Also for 18 teachers from each education centers who will perform their training (Job shadowing training) and UK, Malta, Italy and France.

The main objective of the project is to let participants develop, through training practices in European companies, skills and abilities to complete, in a practical way, the skills acquired in VET.

The main activities carried out in the project partners are: Preparation of mobility, including: Selection of participants, initial assessment of their skills, previous training of participants, logistical and contractual aspects, coordination. Performing stay. Starting the program in companies. Mobility also includes cultural activities. Dissemination activities and mobility itself will create an impact at local, regional and national levels. Although not involved in the project, other organizations at local, regional and national levels will benefit from the project results: Improving the skills of young. A boost on youth employment rates. Possibility of contacts with other European institutions to share best practices. Improving the quality of education provided in schools, curb dropout, expand language skills, Ability to incorporate business networking reception of foreign students. Knowing how new models are used ECVET certification. Besides the impact on the participants, the project will affect the partners promoting European cooperation and rapprochement between business and schools. Motorization. Monitor the evolution of the participants by the means established in the project will take. Project evaluation. Dissemination. Dissemination activities are planned throughout the whole project. A conference final dissemination of results was performed.

Evaluation of the participants. All the process will be certified with ECVET and it will be clearly defined from an initial evaluation. 
The project is directly linked to the 2020 strategic priorities and agrees to help the EU and its Member States to generate higher employment, productivity and social cohesion.

Commerce) and  authomatic and electrical installations (Electricity and Electronics cycle) that will have a trainingship of one month that will allow them to, in the case of students, integrate into their training cycle practices undertaken as part of the module "Training Centers Work "(FCT). The workplacements will be held in Italy, Ireland, Malta,France and Portugal. Also for 18 teachers from each education centers who will perform their training (Job shadowing training) and UK, Malta, Italy and France.

The main objective of the project is to let participants develop, through training practices in European companies, skills and abilities to complete, in a practical way, the skills acquired in VET.

The main activities carried out in the project partners are: Preparation of mobility, including: Selection of participants, initial assessment of their skills, previous training of participants, logistical and contractual aspects, coordination. Performing stay. Starting the program in companies. Mobility also includes cultural activities. Dissemination activities and mobility itself will create an impact at local, regional and national levels. Although not involved in the project, other organizations at local, regional and national levels will benefit from the project results: Improving the skills of young. A boost on youth employment rates. Possibility of contacts with other European institutions to share best practices. Improving the quality of education provided in schools, curb dropout, expand language skills, Ability to incorporate business networking reception of foreign students. Knowing how new models are used ECVET certification. Besides the impact on the participants, the project will affect the partners promoting European cooperation and rapprochement between business and schools. Motorization. Monitor the evolution of the participants by the means established in the project will take. Project evaluation. Dissemination. Dissemination activities are planned throughout the whole project. A conference final dissemination of results was performed.

Evaluation of the participants. All the process will be certified with ECVET and it will be clearly defined from an initial evaluation. 
The project is directly linked to the 2020 strategic priorities and agrees to help the EU and its Member States to generate higher employment, productivity and social cohesion.

PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE VET INTERNSHIP MODEL

"PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE VET INTERNSHIP MODEL " project responds to the need to strengthen the European dimension of vocational training through mobility between countries. It intends to strengthen the role of transnational mobility and strength the EU dimension in vocational training, orienting the target group (young people with no previous work experience , who are looking for their first job or recent graduates and people with few or non formal education, unemployed people who would like
to do an experience abroad) to contribute to the development of this idea of a more tangible Europe.

We will select 60 participants belonging to this categories and send them abroad for a period of 4weeks to do an internship in a sector according to their background and interest. That would allow them to gain valuable work experience that would allow them to be more competitive in the labour market. The project is aimed to give the participant target group the opportunity to acquire new skills through an experience abroad that will enrich them with new working skills, together with a cultural heritage that they will gain through living and working in a foreign country. We will select 10 VET teachers from the professional cycles of the project.
The Spanish consortium is made up of ten high schools of the Valencian Region and ESFMB to act as coordinator and the partners ,(from Ireland, Malta, Italia and Portugal have a huge experience in mobilities in their countries.  Through this project, students can integrate into their training practices undertaken as part of the module "Training at Work" (FCT).

The main objective of is that participants develop through training practices in European companies, skills and abilities to complete, in a practical way, the skills already acquired in VET and efficiently incorporate the common European labour market. They need to develop not only specific and technical skills on the specialty they have studied but also other key skills such as cultural, linguistic, entrepreneurship and personal initiative, ability to work in teams and knowledge of other working environments to facilitate insertion in the European labor market, either self-employed or employed by others.

The main activities carried out by the project partners are:
-Preparation of mobility. Including: Selection of participants, initial assessment of their skills, previous training of participants, logistical and contractual aspects, coordination ... 
-Execution of the stay. Starting the program in companies. Mobility also includes cultural activities.
-Evaluation of the participants. The skills acquired during the project will be certified with ECVET and will be defined from an initial evaluation. The activities within the company will aim to achieve these skills and will be customized for each participant. 
-Monitoring. Monitoring of the evolution of the participants by the means established in the project will be performed.
-Evaluation of the project. 
-Dissemination. Dissemination activities are planned throughout the whole project. A final dissemination conference of the results will be performed.

Besides the impact on the participants, the project will affect the partners promoting European cooperation and rapprochement between business and schools and dissemination activities and mobility itself will create an impact at local, regional and national levels. The project is directly linked to the 2020 strategic priorities and agrees to help the EU and its Member States to generate higher employment, productivity and social cohesion.

Diputación of Pontevedra is a public institution clearly committed to the sustainable development of the province. That is why some projects are focused on addressing the different problems faced by the area: waste management, unemployment, tourism, urban and rural development, sewer mains, etc.

In this sense, this proposal intends to contribute to mitigate the unemployment figures, that remain high, despite the gradual decrease in the unemployment rate since 2012. In addition, there are young people with no motivation for employment, low-skilled in a second language, and with little ICT competences at a professional level, and therefore, with difficulty for access to labour market. Furthermore, we find companies in the province demanding prepared young people, as a consequence of the competitiveness misbalance within the European common market that cannot satisfy companies' needs, feeding the EU skills gap.

In order to overcome such skills gap of the province, with a strong rural character, the Diputación has formed a Consortium, with 37 VET schools in Pontevedra and Employment Workshop and authorized courses with Certificate of Competences, which will offer 105 young VET graduates in one of these centres, the possibility of carrying out work practices, for 6 months (ErasmusPro), in a European company. Participants must return from their mobility within 12 months after obtaining their degree. The international practices will not be part of the Workplace Training Programmes (FCT) but will add value to the training previously carried out in companies in the province.
The participants will also carry out a formative linguistic activity through the online tool "OLS". In the case of participants travelling to Iceland and Norway, they will take an intensive course of language, in a destination of 2 weeks duration.

The countries of destination are: United Kingdom, Ireland, Italy, Portugal, Malta, Germany, Romania, Cyprus, Bulgaria, Poland, Slovakia, Crete, Sweden, Slovenia, Finland, Netherlands, Norway, Denmark, Iceland and France. The mobilities will be completed with preparatory visits of 4 supervisors from the Diputación to Sweden, Crete, Romania and Italy.

The project also includes mobility of 15 teachers and staff of the Diputación who have shown their interest in observing practices in: Portugal, Poland, Slovakia, Italy, Crete, Romania, Sweden, France and Netherlands. The practices will consist of visiting training centres similar to the integrated centres of vocational training in Galicia, in order to learn new didactic methods used in the country of destination.

The 38 entities that are part of the Consortium are:
IES Salvaterra de Miño
IES Montecelo
IES Ramón Mª Aller Ulloa
IES Pintor Colmeiro
CPR San Miguel
IES Rodeira
IES Marco de Camballón
IES Audiovisual de Vigo
IES Antón Alonso Ríos (Tomiño)
IES Plurilingüe Terra de Turonio
IES Luis Seoane
IES Vilalonga (Sanxenxo)
IES Chapela
IES Pedro Floriani
IES Ricardo Mella
Instituto Politécnico Marítimo Pesqueiro do Atlántico de Vigo
Centro de Formación Divino Maestro de Vigo
IES Politécnico de Vigo
IES Indalecio Pérez Tizón
IES A Xunqueira I
IES Johan Carballeira
Colegio Plurilingüe de Vigo
IES Plurilingüe A Paralaia
CIFP A Xunqueira
CAPD Atlántico
CPR Plurilingüe San Fermín
CPR Daniel Castelao
IES A Guía
IGAFA
IES Laxeiro
IES Frei Martín Sarmiento
CIFR A Granxa
Asociación EFA A Cancela
IES Pazo da Mercé
CFEA Lourizán
CPR Centro de Estudios Marcote
IES Antón Losada Diéguez 
Diputación de Pontevedra (coordinator)

Therefore, PRACTICUM DEPO 2018 has set out the following specific targets in order to achieve the overall goal:
- Facilitate the acquisition of professional experience at international levels.
- Increase innovative knowledge and entrepreneurship in the participants.
- Encourage the practice and improvement of a second language and obtaining technical vocabulary of the professional sector of the participants.
- Facilitate the transition from the educational system to the labour market of the participants.
- Promote synergies between the educational and labour worlds
- Develop skills and knowledge that improve their skills and abilities in front of any job, project or situation.
- Implement the concept of European citizenship and become aware of the importance of international mobility to create free and respectful generations with other cultures or societies

It is expected that with PRACTICUM DEPO 2018 will generate more qualified, integral and, therefore, confident young people, favouring the labour integration and contribute to the promotion and sustainability of the Erasmus + programme.

Therefore, PRACTICUM DEPO 2018 has set out the following specific targets in order to achieve the overall goal:
- Facilitate the acquisition of professional experience at international levels.
- Increase innovative knowledge and entrepreneurship in the participants.
- Encourage the practice and improvement of a second language and obtaining technical vocabulary of the professional sector of the participants.
- Facilitate the transition from the educational system to the labour market of the participants.
- Promote synergies between the educational and labour worlds
- Develop skills and knowledge that improve their skills and abilities in front of any job, project or situation.
- Implement the concept of European citizenship and become aware of the importance of international mobility to create free and respectful generations with other cultures or societies

It is expected that with PRACTICUM DEPO 2018 will generate more qualified, integral and, therefore, confident young people, favouring the labour integration and contribute to the promotion and sustainability of the Erasmus + programme.

The LOGRO-EUROPA III Project aims at going one step further on what has been done in the past. Apart from offering training support to recent graduates in VET in order to develop several internships in a working environment in Europe (this way they can face the best way to access the labor market), the Consortium also wants to potentiate the sense of belonging to the European citizenship through the mobilities planned and the social inclusion and integration of all their citizens.

Due to the success and the participants’ level of satisfaction with the first LOGRO-EUROPA, the Consortium has decided to continue and keep improving this project through LOGRO-EUROPA III.  In such a way, participants from Logroño can enjoy the best opportunities of developing their professional training, and improve this way their employability.

In order to maximize the possibilities for these young adults to find a job after developing their VET is not the Consortium’s only priority; finding a job is only a way to ensure the participants to make the transition as productive members of the society. This element is fundamentally important, since youth is one of the collectives which is suffering most from unemployment (which is maybe the most extended way of social exclusion), fighting also against the inequality gap, strongly installed in Spain from the beginning of the economic crisis.

Faced with the increase in migration movements during the past years, the aim is also to give support to the integration of youth through giving them opportunities of development quality VETs and the promotion of the values and models of a European citizenship, as another element to achieve via this project. From our point of view this is the best way of showing the EU achievements in the fields of the European rights and freedoms for their citizens, by allowing the new generations to get first-hand knowledge, through a successful program, as is the Erasmus+.

The target group of this project will be young adults aged between 18 and 35, already graduated on VET within 12 months before the starting point of the mobilities by any of the formative centers in the Consortium. The total amount of mobilities will be of 36; participants will develop their period of internship within the hosting organisations, already contacted in Malta, United Kingdom, Italy, Portugal and Austria, and there will be a permanent contact between these organisations and the intermediaries in each of the destination countries.

Given the great importance of the proposed goals, the organizations taking part of the Consortium will provide the participants with the appropriate tools for acting in the European society in the best way, during the development of their professional training, and also after coming back to Logroño.

The mobilities imply for these young adults participants in the project, the possibility of experiencing in a direct way the common values to all the Member States of the EU, in which it finds its basis. The internalization of values like tolerance, integration and the opportunities for people in disadvantage is constituted as a success factor in achieving a real European society.

Zespół Szkół nr 8 w Szczecinie is applying for the EU project for the second time (vocational education and training funding for learners). In 2016 the school took part in the EU project sending 67 students abroad for workplacement. The students went to Great Britain to Derry/Londonderry. The aims of the apprentice were reached and the cooperation with the partner, North West Academy of English in Derry, was satisfactory and even exceeded the expectations.  This year the principal of the school, Ewa Kupidłowska, decided to take advantage of the EU funds again and let other students of the school participate in the next project. 
This time the workplacement will take place in September 2018 and September 2019 in Derry. Seventy third-year students (35+35) of four educational backgrounds: administration (economy and logistics), hospitality and marketing will visit Northern Ireland. There will be four tutors taking care of them. The students work in British companies for 4 weeks. The participants will be provided with accommodation and board at Irish families. They will also be able to take part in a variety of cultural events and English language classes. The partners will also provide transportation to and from Derry, transport to and from work and additional insurance as well as the 24-hour assistance. 
The general objectives of the project are: project managing skills improvement (the partners), gaining high level of occupational skills (the students), acquiring new methods of vocational education (the tutors), obtaining long life and job-shadowing learning abilities by the students. The latter ones will also be able to polish their language skills,  break a language barrier and improve their personal and social skills. 
The project will include the organization of the following activities: project recruitment process, psychological and cultural induction, apprenticeship safety classes, transportation (to/from  Derry), workplacement (over 30 companies), accommodation, board, free time activities, transport to/from work. All mobility activities will be monitored and evaluated and the results will be disseminated. 
The project results will effect a few groups of people. The first one is the students. Their language, soft and vocational skills will improve. They will acquire experience of working abroad and taking total responsibility for themselves. They will have a chance to realize the importance and effectiveness of European mobility in order to find a job. The next group of beneficiaries is the school. The management of the institution will obtain the ability to deal with EU projects. The school will be able to widen their educational offer and will be perceived as the leader and attraction on the local or even a national educational market. The last but not least is the school graduates. Letting them gain a higher opportunity to find a job not only in Poland but also in Europe will be also a priority. 
The project duration will take two school years.  It will enhance the development of the institution which will be beneficial for the students, teachers and local society and the region soon perceived as the competitive on the national educational services market.

MOVINVET is a mobility project for VET Education, including mobilities for graduates (50) and staff (16).
Graduates will go abroad for 15 weeks, being ErasmusPro, to Uk, Italy, Lithuania, Poland or Slovenia. The aim is to improve their employability through Internships.
Participants will be selected in their last year of study and will do the mobility just after graduation. 
Participants will be selected after a selection process that will be public and common among partners. 

Mobilities for staff will last 4 days, doing a job shadowing with the aim of knowing ECVET system in Italy, and the integration of people at risk of social exclusion in the education system in Austria. 
Participants will be selected by the local schools, one per school

In this year, the project has improved including:

- Extending number of local partner schools, up to 16 integrating the consortium
- Extending the number of mobilities, due to the increasing demand and the increase of local parnters.
- Extending the duration of mobilities for graduates, up to 15 weeks, being ErasmusPro
- A new partner country, Slovenia
- Mobilities for staff to Austria
- Some internal improvements in management

The project is promoted by ALTAIR, and it is an ongoing project since 2014

'The European sales providers of the XXI century of this project are students of Vocational Training Center - CKZiU from Legnica. They specialise in sales services  (8 Students), hairdressing  (13 Students) and food technology and catering services / (14 Students). During their 4-week apprenticeship, students will gain professional experience in highly reputable restaurants  in Spain, hair salons in Italy and various companies, warehouses and commercial outlets in Northern Ireland. Partner organizations will guarantee high quality internships and 'll enable to get valuable professional and interpersonal competences, meeting the expectations of the dynamically changing labor market and the pro-European attitude of young sales providers. Mobility will give project participants not only reliable knowledge about the functioning of high-quality workplaces, methods, techniques, products and health and safety standards, but also 'll enable participation in high-quality services that require a holistic approach to the client , consumer of the 21st century, high personal culture, not only professional abilities but also interpersonal, social and technical. Student's mobility of students specialised in the 3 sectors  is part of the CKZiU strategy, which defines the vision of school and students as open for an international cooperation, able to use modern technology in working with future demanding clients, caring at the same time for the natural environment and human health. Simultainosly they are  aware of the importance of international mobility, foreign language competences and implementation of  the latest technologies, methods and techniques used on the European services market. Student's internships are playing big role in motivating the supervisors an teachers to increase an interest in mobility and encourage them to improve level in communication in foreign language. Mobility should  encourage them to greater activity in taking initiatives, improving qualifications based on international cooperation and the idea of lifelong learning. Additionally, project participants will strengthen participant's self-esteem, overcome barriers related to foreign travel and enable contact with the latest hairdressing technologies, European culinary trends and highly qualified sales staff and technologies used in commerce.  All these experiences  will allow participants to learn and discover entrepreneurship. Students overcome cultural and language barriers and, above all will have the great opportiunity to the use products and techniques not available on the Legnica and regional markets. 
Only open to change and continuous education - young Legnician, can become the foundation for the growth and development of the city, region and country. Gaining the necessary knowledge and skills - in the process of globalization, has a chance to revive the labor market, co-creating an innovative center of growth in the scale of the city, the country and the developing Europe. Expanding the offer in our School for experience on the European labor market will meet the current need so often diagnosed by employers to educate high and adequately to the needs of qualified employees. This is consistent with the first of the six priorities set by the European Commission and member states for the period 2016-2020.The  "Sales Providers of the 21st Century" is also part of the common goal with the Development Strategy of the Lower Silesian Voivodship for the years 2015-2020, which identified in the Legnica-Głogów area  three priorities: These are: increasing the availability of communication and information technologies, social inclusion and raising the quality of life, and raising the level of education and lifelong learning. The objectives of the project also coincide with the Strategy for computerization of the Legnica Commune in 2016-20121, which involves the promotion of Legnica as a modern education city with a diverse and rich labor market, ensured by the developed and innovative service sector, created by the Sales Providers of the 21st century. Thanks to the experience gained during the internship, knowledge and technology will be transferred to our environment, which needs it very much. As a result, the benefits of European mobility will be widespread. We will share all our results with peers, friends, family, Leading Body, Labor Office and local companies. What is extremely important, our experience and results will support the work of vocational counselors, educators of the schools of Legnica and surroundings.
Nowe otwarcie: międzynarodowe staże dla zawodowców

The project titled "New opening: international internships for professionals" implies the participation of 50 people in 4 week internships abroad: in November 2018  - 20 people, and in April 2019 - 30 people. 

The internships will be scheduled in the following groups:

I group - 20 people:
- IT technician - 10 people - Cork, Ireland
- technician of gastronomy and food services - 10 people, Saragossa, Spain

The second group - 30 students: 
- Technician of construction - 10 people - Forli, Italy
- Technician of electrics - 10 people- Maribor, Slovenia
- Technician of sales - 10 people, Londonderry, UK

The main objective of the project is to enchance students development, giving them opportunity to acquire new professional skills and increase their employability through skill development cooperation and skilful move on the international market, together with raising the practical level of their profession.

Specific objectives of this project are:
a) to increase practical work experience (in the direction of education)
b) to increase knowledge of best practices and techniques for working in the profession, operating in foreign companies and institutions.
c) to increase language skills, customer service overseas and cooperation in an international
d) to increase intercultural competence (in particular the cooperation in a team and relationships in the workplace)
e) to increase independence and mobility (openness to new environment, ability to function under different conditions)
f) to develop entrepreneurship and creativity (including learning services markets in the host countries

The project involves the preparation, implementation and evaluation phases, including a workshop on the skills gained from mobility planning for further professional development.The project aims to support education of the students in various professions, to let them learn new skills and get some experience in the mobiliti  abroad, which will be useful for regional labor market and used in the activities of local businesses and institutions.
ITINERARIOS FORMATIVOS AGRICOLAS DE LA VEGA DEL GUADALQUIVIR

In line with the objectives of the Europe2020 Strategy and ET2020, through "agrovega2.0", the consortium, led by the Lora del Rio Council, aims to improve the quality of education and vocational training, giving a European dimension to the educational paths and thus providing the young participants the opportunity to test and improve their skills: professionalism in the specific areas of vocational education (agricultural, agro-industrial and environmental sectors), cultural knowledge and linguistic preparation. This general objective, in line with the ET2020 strategy is pursued through a mobility experience that consists of a learning mobility internship abroad of 13 weeks for 50 particpantes between students for convalidate their compulsory traineeship, recent graduates from sending VET schools and participant from Workshop school with professional certificate belong to Lora del Rio Council. The training programme includes an internship in selected companies in the agricultural, agro-industrial and environmental fields, to acquire knowledge and skills within the sectors and compare the various professional techniques, and activities aimed at the inclusion and integration in the context and for the improvement of language skills and to better know the culture of the hosting country. The main expected results from the project include: the rise of the personal and professional skills of the participants and the promotion of key competencies related to the real exercise of active citizenship; increasing the employment potential of the participants, the introduction of innovative training methods as a complement to existing practices and pathways and the improvement of the educational level of technical and vocational schools, the development of relations between the transnational partners and the promotion of processes of cooperation and exchange of good practices between the partners involved, with a significant impact in improving the educational and vocational guidance.
The construction of a permanent network of transnational public-institutional organisations and not only, therefore, is one of the main objectives of the project and allows the exchange of experiences and best practices at various levels (technical excellence, best practices in educational policies and governance of the system). The Consortium, with this proposal, therefore, aims to give momentum to the internationalization of institutional relations and cooperation at European level. The opportunities for economic and social growth cannot be separated from the desire to create strong interdependence and synergy between educational and training institutions and strong partnerships with local and foreign business realities.
The project works in particular to realise an European area for Lifelong Learning in the agricultural, agro-industrial and environmental sectors.
The whole activities are implemented by regarding a strong European perspective which is reflected in all project activities and results.

Enseñanza y aprendizaje de idiomas en el contexto europeo. Compartiendo experiencias y ampliando horizontes

The purpose of this mobility project is for teachers, management team and administration staff of the EOI of Sagunto to become familiar with the European Union countries' current approaches to language teaching centres and thereby become aware of the need to internationalise the centre and assume the European dimension of the EOI Sagunt, sharing the different problems peculiar to these centres
Among others, the reasons for its realization are:
- The difficult situation of the labour market in Spain and the high dropout rates of adults in adult training centres
- The methodological improvement of the institution with respect to the work of linguistic mediation and interaction. (The CEFR considers this skill at the same level as oral and written comprehension and expression in language teaching. However, there is little literature on the subject compared to the latter).


- The international projection of the institution. The EOI Sagunt is part of a national network of public language teaching centres of recognized pedagogical and certification prestige. It is a unique institution at European level, given that there is no similar official institution at this level depending on the different Ministries of Education of European countries. For this reason we believe that we can contribute our experience as an institution and, at the same time, learn from the management and organization of other types of language teaching centres in different European countries.
- In the framework of the management and also of the methodology, a recurring concern of those responsible for teaching adults is the low level of motivation and loyalty, and the high school dropout rate of adults.
- On the other hand, teachers and management teams need to establish European collaboration networks that allow them to approach:
                   -Business
                   -Schools
                   -Social agents
                   -Local authorities
This will give them the possibility of being in contact with innovative projects, knowing other educational and productive systems, sharing good practices, and knowing the European policies that are being applied, improving the teaching quality that they carry out in the educational centres and helping to combat youth unemployment and early school leaving.
The project is directly linked to the 2020 strategy and agrees on strategic priorities to help the EU and its member states generate a higher level of employment, productivity and social cohesion.

For this we intend:
- to get to know the operation of centres that teach language education in other countries of the European Union
- to get to know the procedures used by other teaching centres and management teams to advise, supervise and evaluate the teaching praxis, which will improve the work they perform in the EOI of Sagunt.
- to know and analyse the relationship between companies and educational centres in other countries of the European Union.
-to establish networks of contacts that allow students and teachers to make training stays.
-to get to know the educational policies and educational systems of the United Kingdom, France and Italy.
-To learn from the different methodologies and language learning strategies used in the United Kingdom, France and Italy.
-To learn from the approach to drop-out of adults in the United Kingdom, France and Italy.
-To learn from the methodological approaches regarding linguistic mediation in the United Kingdom, France and Italy.
-To improve linguistic competence
-To improve ICT competence
-To get to know about the concept of European dimension and Single European labour market.
-To create a network of contacts with entities from other countries for future collaborations.

The LANGUAGE LEARNING IN THE EUROPEAN CONTEXT. SHARING EXPERIENCE AND WIDENING HORIZONS project is designed for 12 participants, including teachers and members of the management team and management and administration staff who develop their professional activity in Official School of Languages of Sagunt (EOI Sagunt) who will carry out the mobility in the United Kingdom, France and Italy.

 The main activities that the EOI of Sagunt will carry out will be:
-Preparation of the mobility that will include: Selection and previous training of the participants, logistical and contractual aspects, coordination of activities.
-Evaluation of the results of the mobility of the participants and their corresponding certification.
-Monitoring of the evolution of the participants through the means established in the project.
-Project evaluation.
-Diffusion. The dissemination activities are planned throughout the entire project. A final dissemination conference of the results will be held.
Level One / Youth Worker Coaching Certificate

Level One Youth Worker Coaching Certificate wants to gather 30 youth workers from 14 countries for an 8 day-training in rural Austria directed towards tackling the challenges posed today by youth unemployment and NEETs.The TC will be an innovative combination of in-dept training on coaching methodologies with outdoor activities and the power of myth, rituals and storytelling as tools for youth work.

Despite the positive signals in the EU economy and labor market in the years following the crisis, youth unemployment and NEETs remains largely a priority issue, especially concerning the growing income disparity in large urban areas, rural migration and the necessary inclusion of refugees and migrants into the European labor market in order to foster sustainable integration and prevent the radicalization of young people. 

Coaching is a learning support measure seldomly used in youth work, and often mistook for either mentoring or counselling. We want to introduce to youth organisations the good practice to have a coach figure, to constantly monitor the development and learning of the youth NGO members as well as their target groups (especially youth vulnerable to NEET situations including refugees, migrants and other marginalized groups). 
Our participant target group is youth workers and volunteers with already some experience in supporting the learning and empowerment of young people. The TC aims to equip them with that extra gear that can allow them to more easily achieve their vision and mission. 

The Level One Youth Workers Coaching Certification sees a path that starts from exploring coaching from the perspective of self-coaching and self-awareness, to coaching others and empower towards self-awareness and goal achievement. Participants will experience through experiential learning, non-formal education and value-based learning a journey across psychology, philosophy, pedagogy and social anthropology. They are going to gain tools, self-awareness, attitudes and competences that will later benefit the target groups of their youth NGOs back home, when being walked through their action plans supported by their peers and the training team. This will be done through an innovative educational path: From Values and Environment analysis created by Prof. C. Graves, over exploring how Dr. Campbell's Monomyth theory is not only an excellent tool for storywriting and story-telling, but also a fantastic tool for coaching towards transformation, participants will travel through the existing models and tools available in corporate and business coaching such as GROW, NLP, and Jungian Archetypes, up to the more attitude-development methodologies implemented by Dr. Plotkin in using outdoor education. 

Participants, besides being trained and certified as youth coaches, will receive a YouthPass Certificate, the Rescogita OU Certification as Coaches (upon demonstration of having conducted at least 20 hours of coaching and reporting it), a manual for Youth Coaching, and a voucher for 1 hour distance coaching. Thus, the training programme contains specific elements that foster the dissemination of aquired knowledge in the participants organisations later on.

Youth exchange "Youth (vs) with seniors" will be held in August 2018 in Lucija (a small town on the slovenian coast).
The main aim of this project is intergenerational cooperation, solidarity and tolerance.
During the exchange 36 young people (aged 16 to 19) and youth leaders from 5 countries (Slovenia, Croatia, Spain, Portugal and Northern Ireland) will exchange ideas and best practices in order to prepare a public intergenerational event including several local organisations ans associations.

TITLE:                                               B.E.S.T 2018   (Bringing European Students Together)

CONTEXT/BACKGROUND
The project originated after young people from REACH Across were hosted in Agros, Cyprus in 2016 and 2017. It was agreed that the 2018 collaboration would be a full youth exchange. Both groups have provided wide-ranging international projects for many years and wanted to deliver a full project so as to maximise the learning, engagement and development outputs. 
APVs will take place in June to allow information to be shared and discussed amongst participants, parents and partner organisations and allow agreed changes or ideas to be implemented.
The first stage of the project will take place in July in Derry, Northern Ireland and the second stage will take place in Agros, Cyprus in August.  Each group will include 12 young people and 2 leaders. 

OBJECTIVES: 
a)  The primary themes are to foster mutual understanding between young people in each country and to promote European co-operation in the youth field. 
b)  The project aims to increase the awareness of participants in relation to cultural traditions, society and youth-related issues in other European countries. It will have a wide-ranging content so as to
      promote inclusion, personal learning and life enhancing experiences. It will also encourage participants to understand the social consequences of conflict, racism or extremism and to make 
      recommendations for Shared Futures in each country and for a more integrated society in Europe. 
c)   The project will encourage participants to be more active, healthier and respectful citizens and to develop personal skills, confidence levels and social input, that will have a positive impact on their 
       communities.
d)   The project will give participants an insight into the benefits of European co-operation and to establish a working partnership for future projects.
e)   Through outdoor activities and several sports, the project will promote healthy lifestyles as an additional means of fostering inclusion and active participation.
f)    Participants will spend a lot of quality time together in order to get to know each other and understand each other’s mentality and culture. The scheduled events and workshops aim to help the 
       participants develop their ability to engage with and understand other people of different cultures. 
Our project is an initiative that is designed to:
      -Highlight the richness and diversity of cultures in Europe
      -Celebrate the cultural features that Europeans share
       -Increase European citizens' sense of belonging to a common cultural area
       -Foster the contribution of culture to the development of mutual understating and solidarity.

NUMBER AND PROFILE OF PARTICIPANTS 
Each stage of the project will have 12 young people from each group (24 in total) and 2 Leaders per group (4 in total)

VENUES/DATES OF APVs AND PROJECT STAGES
Advance Visits will take place in Derry and Agros in June and Stage 1 of the project will take place in Derry in July and Stage 2 will take place in Agros in August

DESCRIPTION OF ACTIVITIES 
The project will be a combination of educational visits, development workshops, outdoor activities and groupwork sessions. Some events include
Education Visits:    N. Ireland Parliament (to learn about political structure), Peace Walls (to observe structures of division and consequences of sectarianism), Local Museums (to increase awareness 
                                   of local history and key events in our Conflict)
Workshops:              Social Awareness (better understanding of local initiatives, issues and planning), Good Relations ( to raise awareness of cultural traditions, symbols, challenges and issues)
Outdoor Activities:  Watersports Day, Indoor Sports, Combat games, mini Olympics

METHODS:  
Project aims and objectives will primarily be achieved through non-formal learning workshops along with educational/social/cultural visits to landmark locations and community organisations. Interaction and engagement will also be achieved through sports, activities and aesthetic sessions.

DESCRIPTION OF RESULTS AND IMPACT 
a)  Better understanding of current political, social and cultural initiatives and issues in both countries
b)  More active, healthier and environmentally-friendly young people
c)   Increased personal skills, confidence levels and wellbeing amongst young people

POTENTIAL LONGER TERM BENEFITS
a)  Participants have increased their employability through new skills and competences and through a greater understanding of acceptable behaviours and social expectations
b)  The project will have raised participant awareness of international volunteering and personal development opportunities and of support that may be available to avail of these opportunities
