We continue to organize and implement our most successful projects, we have been doing since 2012, but we are striving to add more projects with different countries and areas to boost the process of internationalisation at our school and region.
What we have been doing so far includes the following projects:

1. a,This is a learning stay of three weeeks in GB for apprentices at our partner college the "European College of Business &     Management". The participants come from all different departments of our college which is a pure business and commercial college.      is not an exchange program. We go there for learning purposes and get certificates of the AHK at the end and the title of "Kaufmann International".
The project is run in two flows:
1st flow: 14.05.17 - 03.06.17
2nd flow: 03.06.18 - 23.06.18

1st flow: 19.05.19 - 08.06.19
2nd flow: 10.05.20 - 30.05.20
   b,  Aim of the project:
        Participants are expected to improve their professional, linguistic, cultural skills.

2. There is a learning program with our partner institution in Spain (Vic)  for 16 apprentices which takes place yearly. It is especially for freight forwarding, wholesale and industrial clerks. In the ongoing year the financial European support has already been granted till 2019. The flow will take place for the 5th time.

3. There are 2 apprentices who are doing an additional 2-weeks placement with Schenker in Barcelona. It supplements the course mentioned in No.2.

4. In March 2018 we organize a teacher training course for 16 teachers of our school. This is a training programme for our coleagues who are also teaching English at our institution. It will take place in the "European College of Business & Management" in London and will last for a week A visit is planned to the MidKent College in Kent and we hope that the colleagues can study  the vocational educational  training and apprenticeship of our neighbour country and ameliorate the knowledge about GB. They should also imprive their linguistic competences and get new ideas for didactic methods. We would like to repeat and implement this program and so we apply again for funding to do another flow in the academic year 2019/2020. We also intend to invite colleagues of other schools as well.

For the oncoming year we are planning new projects:

5.We will go to Northern Ireland to Derry with 16 of our colleagues and we will visit the NorthWest Regional Col. in Derry. We hope that there will develop an exchange programme done with techers as lond as this will be possible under the white elephant of Brexit. Northernirish colleagues are kindly invited to come to our school and also visit companies in our area to get to know and learn more about our dual system.

6. However, we also intend to create a new program for students of our office management department. They should attend school there as well as attending companies to see and to get to know different styles of vocational learning. We do apply for 2 flows - 1 in each year - for a number of 10 students each year. Up to now office management has always been a group which did not participate in any European programs and we would like to change this and integrate them as well and offer them possibilities to experience other cultures and get to know other traditions. We very much hope that we also will be able to host students from the NWRC to create a real exchange of students.

7. We were lucky to find another new partner in the Netherlands in Alkmaar, the Horizon College. 9 teachers, 7 from our college BS4 and 2 from our neighbouring college 5 are going to Alkmaar in October to prepare a students´programme together with our partner colleagues. We intend to work out special modules where we can teach the group coming from 2 different countries a common topic which is valuable for both of them. This could be done in the frame of ECVET.

8.5 apprentices from sales executive will be going to the netherlands to do a three-weeks internship in the Netherlands. Our institution is already hosting 2 students from the Netherlands to help them finding placements in our companies of freight forwarding. Sending apprentices abroad to fulfil placements is new for our school. We haven´t done this before as companies in the dual system are always reluctant to release staff to be abroad over a longer period of time. However, times have changed in favour of us and more and more enterprises seem to support a three weeks stay abroad. Our partner in the Netherl. is extremely reliable and we are convinced that our program will be successful and it will be expandable and developable.

Up to now we were lucky to win and add new partnerships and we experienced a high amount of support in doing this. We have started EU-mobility programs six years ago and are developping slowly into a sort of hub and we will involve other vocational colleges in the region  via our own programs  or by giving them advise how to launch new European mobility programs

Project background and aims: The project is part of the ESO Education Group’s (Euro Schools Organisation) internationalisation strategy. The Würzburger Dolmetscher Schule is an independent brand within the organisation. The courses offered in the ‘Berufsfachschule’, a post-16 vocational training college, focus on current practice in companies in Germany and abroad and even afford graduates of the programme who have a secondary school leaving certificate the opportunity to enrol on international Bachelors and Masters programmes, once they have completed other training courses. To facilitate this we have established networks and partnerships with universities abroad in recent years, some of which recognise our qualifications as Bachelors equivalents.

Number and profile of participants and time of mobility: Number of participants in June 2018: 60. For participants enrolled on their first course, placements are arranged for the summer months of the students’ first or second year (or third year where applicable). For those undertaking further study, the work placement should be completed at the end of the first and second year of their two or three year programme:

Option 1: Students complete a work placement at the end of their first year in the UK, France or Spain lasting between 4 and 8 weeks in July/August. Participants already have a good command of their first foreign language and are familiar with business correspondence.

Option 2: Students complete a work placement at the end of their second (or third) year (graduates) in the UK, France or Spain lasting between 4 and 8 weeks in August/September.

The outcome of the placement is documented in the Europass Mobility/Languages, alongside the evaluations by our partners and students’ mentors. Online language tests are scheduled at the start and end of the placement via the National Agency’s specially- developed portal. These assessments are designed to gauge students’ progress during the placement. Participants are also required to submit a final report, uploading it to the National Agency’s website, in which they take stock of their time abroad, their experience as a whole and what they have gained from the placement.

Activities outline and project execution: Initial information events, supervision of the registration process, initiating and maintaining contact with partner and host institutions abroad, support during the CV-writing stage, evaluation, accounting tasks, sharing experiences with others interested in applying, and marketing.

Intended results and impact as well as anticipated long-term benefits: The school’s mobility project should, through a practical, integral learning experience, enable budding foreign language correspondents, translators, interpreters and European secretaries to consolidate their linguistic skills, acquire further knowledge of specialist terminology used in the relevant sector of their host company and strengthen intercultural competence through the development of key skills such as tenacity, taking responsibility for the completion and delegation of tasks, team spirit, conflict management skills, and planning and organisational competencies. The project is realized with the cooperation of various European partners with whom we have collaborated on previous mobility projects in recent years.

The project supports an internationalisation strategy which through the provision of learner and staff mobility contributes to innovate the educational offer of VET schools in the whole Ravenna Education district and supports the measures for youth employability in the transition from school to the labour market. Hence the choice to align the offer of learner mobility to the development of professional skills more responsive to the needs of the main economic sectors of the territory (marketing,foreign trade, the agro-food industry, tourism, hospitality and culture). As to staff mobility the focus is on strategic areas like CLIL, alternating training, internationalisation of the VET system and Digital education, in line with the National Scheme for Staff training.

The mobility methodology for learner mobility lies its grounds on an  integrated approach of non formal learning in the form of training in companies & work-based learning (the focus will be on new media and digital professions) , counselling and reflection activities on European identity and European citizenship of young learners/VET newgraduates. 
This approach meets at one time educational, vocational, information and civic needs in a coherent framework of the Strategies for Europe 2020, in terms of acquisition of key skills and a new approach in counselling focused on “education to employability”.

As accompanying measures for staff mobility, we will deliver  preparatory workshops on Internationalisation strategies and EDP for schools, while host partners will complement job shadowing with workshops on CLIL(UK), EU VET Systems, best practices of alternating training and Digital Education.
We will build up work-groups among staff on issues of common interest shared through mobility, which should ensure and strengthen networking beyond the project lifecycle.

MOBILITY VOLUME & TYPE

Staff mobility: 30 participants in training for job shadowing.

Learner mobility: 70 participants: 30% new graduates – 70%  learners in the IV year, 11% E+ PRO- in the Hospitality sector, so as to support professional development and employability in a key ecomomic sector for our territory.

Accompanying staff for flows with minor students.

Host countries: France, Germany, Malta, Spain, Ireland and UK.

Length: betwwen 2 weeks (staff), to 5-7 weeks  (short learner mobility) & 3 months (long term learner mobility).


EXPECTED IMPACT ON END USERS AND ON OUR EDP

LEARNERS:
Expected better self-confidence and awareness of resources thanks to the acquisition/improvement of technical, soft and behavioural skills (mainly better entrepreneurship in problem solving, taking over tasks with more responsibility, better time management and organisational skills).
Entrepreneurship along with openness to the new should turn into a better awareness in the choices to make after school, either for job or further studies and a feeling to be more equipped to take new challenges. A perception of better  mid-term prospects in the labour market with more confidence and with an international profile:
- learners can better imagine themselves working abroad in the future or in an international context, able to work with colleagues of different background and communicating better in a different language, with a better intercultural awareness;
- they can think of brighter prospect in the labour market: able to find new/better jobs, easier to get a traineeship or a job and to carry out tasks of more responsibility.

Hence benefits on learners, ranging from skill achievements and better employability to empowerment, growth in European awareness and citizenship.

STAFF:
The project  will contribute to :
- professional development (acquisition of technical skills in their VET area of teaching, language, social and  intercultural skills, not least, learning to learn)
- pedagogical and organisational improvement
- better understanding of the key rules for a suitable International strategy in Education and confidence with the main steps and criteria for EDP (European Development Plan)
- networking skills and the chance to share with their schools the new contacts developed for future project development and exchange of good practice and know how (both at a local and European level).

OUR EDP:
Sustainability of our mobility methodology and counselling approach and systemic provision of mobility in a context of quality management.
Strengthened our networking skills and relationship with Education stakeholders,  synergic cooperation in the internationalisation and Development plans of VET schools.

IMPACT STUDIES:
Studies and surveys on end user and stakholders will measure the impact both in and outside our establishment, showing the main areas of improvement and innovation on our EDP and at Institutional level (VET Education), not least, the efficacy of mobility to foster personal development (learners) and professional growth (staff). 
 The results will be  shared   in our dissemination  activities.

SMART CAREERS PROMOTION represents the ideal continuation and expansion of the previous edition of WORKSTAR project. The proposal is part of the already launched and consolidated process of internationalization that sees the Institutes involved in many projects in cooperation with other schools or public and private organizations, aimed at fostering the European dimension of formal and non-formal learning for an employment policy addressed to the international context.
The project originates from an analysis of the training needs expressed by the Veneto manufacturing sector in relation to the introduction and progressive affirmation within the production processes and to the organization of work of changes related to Smart Manfacturing.
To fully exploit the potentials related to the enhancement of the local territory, the Consortium members need to support a new development cycle based on the principles of competitiveness, technological innovation and quality that can only be successful with adoption of a strategy focused on an international vision of the didactic-training actions.
The project therefore intends to offer an answer to the increasingly urgent challenges that affect the regional territory:
- increasing the technical and professional skills of the new professional profiles required in the Smart Specialization sectors
- contributing to the employability of young people by offering training experiences to develop communication skills in foreign languages and interpersonal skills in multicultural contexts.
The above is consistent with the Research and Innovation Strategy for the Smart Specialization of the Veneto Region which promotes the development of human resources and their international mobility also through the establishment of skills ecosystems.
In this perspective, the project aims to provide 131 students with the opportunity to undertake a 4-week period of training mobility abroad recognized as ASL (in line with the provisions of Law 107/15). Technical-technological (Mechanics / Mechatronics, Electronics, Informatics, Logistics) and economic (AFM, RIM and SIA) study curricula are involved and targets industrial profiles and related support services. The destinations in the UK, IE, FR, DE, ES and FI are confirmed and a new country and partner has been introduced in Poland, extending the opening to the East already started in 2016.
The mobility flows will be preceded by an intense phase of pedagogical and linguistic preparation. The language communication skills will be exercised both in curricular programs and through awareness-raising of the participants towards commitment and self-learning (through the use of the OLS), but alsowith strengthening activities within the educational offer.
The scouting activity will be carried out in collaboration with foreign partners in the different countries through the involvement of companies operating mainly in Smart Specialization fields belonging to the Consortium's already consolidated network and new companies intercepted also through the CCIAA network abroad. The Consortium will provide students with constant support during their stay. The high percentage of underage beneficiaries requires the involvement of carefully selected accompanying persons who will play a key role in facilitating the socio-cultural integration in the host country and supervision and monitoring of activities.
The project also envisages 7 mobilities in the UK addressed to the staff of the Consortium Institutes in order to offer not only a linguistic update, but also innovative didactic approaches tailored to the identified needs. The primary need is to have access to continuous training in the areas of new learning environments, networking, development of new teaching techniques and CLIL.
As outlined in the European Development Plans and in line with the 2016-2019 PTOF, the Consortium members intend to renew and reinforce their training offer in the direction of a European perspective, continuing to promote and implement international activities. The Erasmus + 2017-1-IT01-KA116-006044 project for 125 students and 6 teachers is currently being implemented. The commitment continues:
- in the expansion of the offer of language training and certification courses in various languages (participation in the MOVE 5.0 projects financed by the ESF Veneto Region);
- in the promotion of CLIL methodology and job shadowing activities abroad (ETwinning)
- in the upgrading and improvement of hosting services
- in the implementation of tools for the management of all phases of mobility
- in the expansion of the offer of cultural exchanges and stays abroad also through the consolidation of European networks

Rijn IJssel set out its priorities in a strategic plan on international activities. Here it is stated that international activities are important for Rijn IJssel in the perspective that they contribute to improve the quality of the education for the students and support innovation topics.
Objectives are:
• Enlarging the amount of students involved in international activities The aim for period 2015-2020 is to establish 2285 mobilities (including 1075 for student – and 265 staff mobility in Erasmus, 800 in the framework of Interreg project Learning Euregion, 25 staff will participate in Erasmus mobility organised by The Dutch Alliance and 120 mobilities will be established by own funding of the students and or the college)
• Improving the quality of international mobility by applying ECVET 
• Providing study visits for professionals as a support of innovation topics. 
In the Plan for Excellence, 2015-2020 objectives are described regarding international contacts, for the targetgroup of Excellent students. 5 Type of programs are selected:
• Excellence within the Learning Euregion
• Excellence on world-scale
• Excellence for professionals using foreign language as instruction language
• Excellence by transition programs towards foreign universities
• Excellence by transition programs towards labourmarket abroad.
In het framework of Excellence it was also decided that every department will participate in 1 skills competetion. With the current Erasmus-application call 2018 we make a step in the direction of establishing the mentioned strategic objectives. In this call we describe the flows for in total 420 students (in 2017 this was 390 students). Included are also 40 staff (in 2017 this was 45 staff).
In the Erasmunplus guidelines for call 2018 is ErasmusPro described. From the total flow of 420 students, the group of long-term students is 83.
We want to mention the following developments regarding the mobility of students and staff:
• The interest in Germany and the German language is increasing: in call 2017 we mentioned 125 mobilities to Germany, in the call 2018 150 students are involved.
• Rijn IJssel concludes that currently mainly students of level 3 and 4 step forwards to participate in mobility programs. In the perspective of the view of Erasmusplus that all students should be granted the possiblity to participate, a plan has been developed focussing on the group of Social care-students level 2, to develop an Orientation–mobility program. This example of Social Inclusion will be developed together with host North West Regional College (NWRC) in Londonderry. Keypoint will be the workingmethod with tandems of UK and Dutch students while working on Orientation on the professional field of Social care, visit Social care-institutes and follow classes. In the preparation and organisation special attention will be set on an extended preparation program including language and solic guidance during the mobility.
• The workingmethod of the so-called Language-internship (Taalstage), in which the learning of the language is applied directly to assignments in companies, is successful. It is now applied to programs in the English, Spanish and German language.
• Rijn IJssel aims to connect staff mobility to support innovation-topics. In call 2018 we involve 2 staff study visits:
• In the perspective of organising Long-term mobility for the professional field of Health Care, we include in the application a flow Advanced Planning Visit to support the development of Long term mobility 3-12 months for students.
• In line with the projectplan Ecvet in Rijn IJssel, departments are developing sustainable links towards Memoranda of Understanding. In 2017 we signed a Memorandum of Understanding with 2 Finnish VET schools. In 2018 more will follow.
Aside the Erasmus-mobilities, other international activities are developed and established. In this perspective again exchanges are planned with German schools, supported by the Interreg project of Learning Euregion. Furthermore Excellence / International activities will be offered to students and staff; Germany will have a central place here. Also staff will participate in study visits organised by The Dutch Alliance and students will be visited at their practice place abroad.
Ambassadeurs voor Europa door Erasmus+ : beter onderwijs  voor iedereen door kennisuitwisseling in Europa

"Every student internationally  competent "  is  Friesland College's slogan in the upcoming policy plan in 2018. Presently we focus on increasing  the number of students and professionals going abroad and on receiving more students from our 
European partners, not only for VET but also for Adult Education. Our strategic partnerships strenghten the bond with our partners abroad. Curriculum comparison and exchange of good practice enriches our educational programmes.  Students share their experiences with peers and on social media and their enthousiasm make them the best Ambassadors for Europe. We want our students to get acquainted with European values and to get used to working with people from different cultures.  Internationally compent students also means focus on Internationalisation at Home. Workshops, cross-sectoral projects and choice modules International 1 and 2 are already part of the curriculum.

The quality of our placements abroad remains one of our goals. Therefore we use solid and renowned training companies recognised by SBB. This is safeguarded by agreements with companies in the context of the new Qualification files of the Dutch government. In the Learning Agreements of Friesland College (i-BPV) content, monitoring, validation, recognition and evaluation of the experiences abroad is described. 

The realisation of ErasmusPro placements for apprentices is a new challenge.  Some of the education programmes will investigate the possibilities for students with an employee contract to go abroad for a special training for at least 3 months.  That requires consultation with employers.  For that reason, we will apply for some Advanced Planned Visits.(APV) 

We will give attention to the European Year of Cultural Heritage 2018  for those countries that  joined this initiative.  An assignment will be incorporated in the choice module International 2 (Working abroad) as well as an elaborate preparation for their period abroad.  
Modern Language choice modules,  in view of the professional context, can be considered as a new element in the Erasmus+ grant allocation. 
 
Developing SOCIAL ENTREPRENEURSHIP, the new approach of empowering students of level  4+ EQF.   Communication skills, using English in a natural setting, meeting young people in other countries, being part of their peer-to-peer training in social entrepreneurship are themes within this programme. Developing personal leadership in a programme of excellence enables them to follow a path of growth, on a multisectoral level. Teachers and students will be trained abroad within the companies involved.  This training enables students to start up companies while studying.  The collaboration with Higher Education students will be extented. They will  be involved for guidance of our students and for research matters.

We continue our social inclusion project for our 2EQFstudents of Facility Management and Care taking,  the socially challenged group of students who we offer a placement of 3 weeks  on Malta for their personal growth and for improving their position on the labour market. This group will be accompanied by 2 professionals. An elaborate selection procedure and extensive preparation is part of the allocation proces. 

Internationally competent students demand international competent teachers. Personal and professional development  is becoming increasingly important in relation to Excellence and quality control and in view of their role as Ambassador.  The professionals are well aware of the importance of their input and influence on the educational programmes.
Improving the educational proces and stimulating new innovative approaches in education  within Europe through curriculum comparison,  exchanging of good practice, jobshadowing,  workshops are part of the assignments for our staff. They will also be involved in describing Learning Units and Learning Outcomes for ECVET matters.  The difference in educational systems in Europe remains a challenge.

Leeuwarden and Valletta (Malta) are the Capitals of Culture 2018.  Sharing our experiences of the effect on the cultural diversity, economic situation of the regions involved and labour markets is one of the goals we want to achieve.   A large number of students and teachers support the projects of Cultural Capitals.  The number of  outgoing and incoming students from countries involved increase enormously.  Friesland College has  full heartedly committed to joining  the festivities and supporting the activities and international cooperation. In this call attention will be paid to sharing our experiences with  students and professionals in Plovdiv (Bulgaria) and Matera (Italy), the capitals of culture in 2019.

The Mobility Mid-Norway project (MMN) is a continuation of Nord and Sør-Trøndelag's previous Erasmus+ mobility projects . From 01.01.18 the counties were assembled to Trøndelag County municipality, which is now seeking the mobility project MMN with charter «accreditation reference» 2015-1-NO1-KA109-013311. Both of the former Counties  are chartered for the Erasmus + program  period 2014-2020 ( North-Trøndelag in 2009, 2015.  South-Trøndelag from 2015)

The application is based on a politically adopted strategy for internationalization in  North- and South-Trøndelag 2013-2016 and Trøndelag county municipality's financial plan 2018-2021. In addition, former North-and South-Trøndelag have own strategic documents that underline the work of internationalization in  secondary education and in mobility projects. In the economic plan for Trøndelag county municipality, it says that "The county municipality will facilitate internationalization to be a tool in the learning work for both pupils and apprentices in upper secondary education." Further in the document, Fylkesplan for Trøndelag 2018-2030, Trøndelagsplanen, is referred to as the most important basis for discussing overall goals and strategies for Trøndelag. Internationalization is referred to as one of four main topics in this plan.

Through the project MMN, Trøndelag County Municipality wishes to achieve:
- a strong regional approach of internationalization at training offices and World of Work through a strong focus on employee mobility in this project, engage more companies into mobility in order to  get international competence and knowledge of Erasmus + mobility.
- together with actors from the county and tWorld of Work carry out mobility for students, apprentices, vocational teachers, instructors and other professionals associated with vocational education.

We wish to ensure that schools, training offices and World of Work  across the former countyes boaders  will increase their competence  about internationalization as a tool in professional training and development of industries.

The activity level in the MMN project is otherwise adapted to the new county and is based on charter applications from former North- and South-Trøndelag. The activities will ensure the planned development of international work in upper secondary education.

Trøndelag county municipality plans to carry  out 279 mobilities by the following activity types:
- 97 long-term mobility for apprentices.
-36 short-term mobility for students and apprentices.
-166 employee mobility on shorter hospitalization stays.

Mobility will be conducted in cooperation with partners in Denmark, Germany, Ireland, UK, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Iceland, Slovenia and the Czech Republic. For students, stays will last from 2-4 weeks, while the stays for the apprentices will in most cases last for about 3 months. For students, the placement will be linked to the subject of vocational education, while apprenticeship will be part of the apprenticeship. Employee mobility will vary from 4-6 days.

One of the objective of mobility in MMN is to fase for business needs for international competence. Through participation in the project, apprentices, students and professionals will be given the opportunity to increase their competence, both professionally, culturally, linguistically and personaly. These are key values within international competence that are transferable to other situations of life. These experiences will therefore be valuable contributions to the individual's lifelong learning process and useful competence also for fellow students, colleagues and workplaces in their home country.

Another objective of the project is to develop further the international work in vocational education and training in Trøndelag, in line with the rest of the planning work in the new county.

A third objective of the project is to share knowledge about ECVET in the county: utilize several years of experience from the Nord-Trøndelag county, which is a National ECVET Expert. The use of ECVET tools should give Erasmus Mobility recognition and transfer of learning between different learning environments and across borders and systems in Europe. Ecvet methodology and practical approach will contribute to placement, professional education and high-quality study stays. Through this, Trøndelag county municipality will achieve a strong regional approach in companies for international mobility as approved part of education in Norway with assessed and approved sub-education from abroad.

There is a clear expectation that the participants increase their international competence through MMN and that their individual learning outcomes will contribute to internationalization at learning arenas and in companies in Trøndelag. The project will be one of the contributions that Trøndelag County Municipality achieves its overall goals in internationalization of upper secondary education and  training and also of World of Work in Trøndelag.
Rozvoj odborných kompetencií v službách a remeslách

The project called “Development Of The Professional Competencies in Services and Crafts” is designed for 16 students and 8 teachers of The Secondary Comprehensive School Techniques and Services in Brezno. The students study in the apprenticeship fields of innkeeper and shop-assistant and in the study fields of catering, computer mechanics, and engineering. The project is focused on students developing their professional, linguistic, cultural-social skills, and competencies in the vocational training in the sphere of techniques and services, and equally the project is focused on teachers obtaining new experiences and improving their professional skills.
The internship will take place in three countries and in four partner organizations. 
In the Czech Republic, The Secondary School Of Hotel Services And Gastronomy in Prague organizes five-week internships for 4 students of the gastronomy field (waiter, cook) in the hotels and restaurants in Prague, and The Secondary Technical School in Ústí nad Labem arranges nine-day mobility for 2 teachers of the technical fields and three week mobility for 6 students of the technical fields who will work in the engineering companies and in companies focused on for a computer service.
In Northern Ireland, The North West Academy of English in Londonderry secures four-week internship for 6 students. The computer mechanics will participate in the management and maintenance of computers and their networks in the companies. Students of the engineering industry will carry out practice in engineering firms and in machine workshop. Students of gastronomy fields (waiter, cook) will work in restaurants and different departments of the catering industry and shop-assistants in the shop with a wide variety of items.
In Italy, the partner organization Azzurra cooperative sociale arranges internship for 6 teachers of gastronomy fields.
Opposite plan in the application for the charter we have increased a number of student by 4. There are especially students of engineering fields – either an apprenticeship tool maker or study field of engineering. Fastened cooperation with The Secondary Technical School in Ústí nad Labem promises high quality practice for our students in its partner firms which our teachers attended within the scope of mobility. We want also our students – school leavers to take part in mobility. 
Accompanying persons take part in all three turns. Most participants will be underage and also there are students who come from social disadvantageous background that is why the presence of accompanying people is inevitable. Parents and also management of school ask for the presence of accompanying people because the school is responsible for its students. Accompanying persons will monitor student practice and solve unforeseen situations, possible discords and requirements which are occurred during the mobility. 

The main aim of the project is to acquire new professional skills and personality growth for participants in order to improve opportunities to make them useful in the domestic and European labourmarket. Additionally, teachers will receive new experiences, skills for secondary technical schooling and with that they will improve the quality of professional education at our school.
Another aim of the project is to build up the attraction and sense of technical education,especially for participants of the internship and secondarily for their schoolmates, colleagues, parents and more general public. This is conducted by means of dissemination of project results to motivate the other students, tutors, teachers of vocational practice for lifelong learning to improve the quality of education and their personality growth, and increase attractiveness of fields in the sphere of crafts and services, and to raise credit of The Secondary Comprehensive School Techniques and Services in its region.
The participants will make presentations in which they will present what professional competencies they got from the mobility. This is done with the aid of various activities and products: brochures, magazines, articles in local periodicals, photography exhibition. We want to motivate other students and teachers for the foreign professional mobility, and also motivate students at primary schools to study at our school. After completing the internship, the participants of the project get Europass-Mobility and the certificates, and it will be a big help in their professional growth. Participants‘observations, experiences, and professional competencies and consequently their implementation into the teaching syllabi of the school educational program and the strategy of school development will be a great contribution for the organization and region.

Background
 
Hyria Education (Hyria) is a multidisciplinary educational institution offering vocational education and training. Hyria operates in the rapidly growing Hyvinkää – Riihimäki region which has nearly 90 000 residents, 34 000 jobs, and 5000 companies of which many operate internationally. 
 
The development of international operations is very important to Hyria and therefore internationalisation was one of the focus points in its strategy and operations for the period of 2011-2017. In a new strategy internationalisation is not mentioned as a focus point, but it takes in the account of changing needs of workers’ skills and competence due to the e.g. digitalisation, urbanisation, climate change and globalisation. Hyria strategy is not set for the specific timeframe, but it can be modified if necessary due to fast change of the operational environment.

International activities at Hyria are aiming to increase our students, teachers and work life partners’ professional and international skills by offering them a possibility to participate in the international mobility programs. By enabling our students and teachers to acquire new skills and knowledge the quality of education increases as well as student’s employment opportunities. At the same time, Hyria fosters the co-operation with the world of work and serves the needs of the area’s working life by producing a highly skilled workforce. 

Objectives and expected results

The most important objective is to increase the students’ professional skills, knowledge and attitudes by emphasizing the acquisition and development of key competencies of lifelong learning.
 
The exchange period comprehensively enables students to develop the key competencies which are needed for personal fulfilment and development, active citizenship, social inclusion and employment. During the exchange period students encounter new situations; they apply already gained knowledge and language skills in practice; learn to use new technological solutions and platforms while communicating with their teachers, friends and family in the home country; and they compare working methods, the acquisition of technical solutions, the level of sustainable development and legislative issues in the host country.
 
In addition, students are able to develop international and personal capabilities such as cultural awareness, language skills, interpersonal skills, individual growth, independence and the ability to work in a multicultural environment. For teachers the project activities give a possibility to update their professional knowledge and understanding of current requirements of a working life.  

With the help of this experience the students and teachers’ professional identity gets stronger, and they are able to find out more field-specific professional development possibilities. It enriches the education in many ways, as well as encourages students’ to entrepreneurship and language learning. 

The second objective is to continue the development of international activities at Hyria. In this time the development activities are focused on the following issues: 

- The evaluation system of international activities will be improved. 
- Mobility statistics will be improved. The implemented periods are compared with the estimated ones by departments and target groups.  
- The organisation of international activities at Hyria (better involvement of adult learners).
- Inclusion of international activities into implementation plans of the new curricula.
- Developing an international learning pathway for students.
- Shifting from short-term co-operation agreements to long-term ones (MOU, LOI).
- Creating a centralized mobility process, instructions and orientation to teachers and staff members. 
- Updating the programme for international activities. 

As a result of these activities the mobility periods are implemented according the ECVET procedures, the procedures of international activities are improved, internationalisation at home is expanded, internationalisation is spread into the different departments and students. In addition to that, the transparency of student guidance is improved (blogs as learning diaries) and we have a stronger cooperation with companies. 

Mobility

This application comprises 61 student mobility periods covering 25 different vocational qualifications. Exchange periods are offered to Hyria’s second or third year students (young), but also to adult students and recent graduates can participate. 5 selected students will receive additional monetary support (exceptional costs) for living and cultural expenses due to the fewer opportunities (economical). 

The mobility of staff and world of work (22 persons) is connected to teacher/expert exchanges, visiting new partners and work placements for quality reasons. There will be also 4 people invited to teach and guide Hyria’s students of the health care sector.

In the strategy of Kainuu Vocational College internationalization is regarded as an important part of the development work in the college.  The student mobility has the key role in the international actions of the college. Student mobilities are target-oriented and they are based on curricula. The aim for the staff is that that staff members are able to work in multi-cultural and international environment and they actively develop international affairs in their own career and teaching.   
The main objective of this project is to offer students and teachers possibilities to have an on the job learning, working or studying periods abroad.  Also through this project we want to improve the quality of the mobility process. Other aims are:
- to activate language skills of the participants
- to improve the knowledge of  culture and working life in foreign countries
- to improve social skills and group working skills in multi-cultural environment
- to improve professional skills and make them more versatile 

The participants are 62 students and ten teachers or representatives of working life. They represent all sectors and units of the school.  The participation in the project is open for all students in youth and adult education. All participants have enough professional skills and courage to participate.  Also all teachers are able to apply to participate in mobilities. 
The mobilities will be implemented according to instructions of the school. The coordinator is responsible for administration tasks. The supervising teacher will contact the receiving partner and they agree on all practical matters during the mobility. The participants will acquire European Health Insurance Card. The school has insurances for participants.  The learning outcomes will be assessed, validated and recognized. The participants will give feedback using Mobility Tool programme. The learning and cultural experiences will be shared in the school.

KANSAINVÄLISYYSSTRATEGIA
Ammatillisen koulutuksen reformi on muuttamassa toimintaympäristöä ja opettajan työtä merkittävällä tavalla. On entistä tärkeämpää keskittyä työpaikalla järjestettävän koulutuksen laatuun, jolloin myös kv-toimintaan tarvitaan lisää opettajien kv-jaksoja ja tiiviimpää yhteistyötä opintoalojen ja kv-kumppanien välillä. Luksian kansainvälisyysstrategia 2012-2015 onkin päätetty päivittää kevään 2018 aikana. Kv-strategia kaipaa uudistusta ja toisaalta uusia ideoita, joita haemme henkilöstöltä, opiskelijoilta sekä kv- ja työelämäkumppaneilta. Toisaalta monet kv-strategiassa esitetyt tavoitteet, etenkin laadulliset sellaiset, on jo saavutettu. Olemme:
- Laajentaneet kv-verkostojamme kotimaassa ja ulkomailla
- Kehittäneet henkilöstön osaamista kv-työelämäjaksojen ja kv-projektien kautta
- Lisänneet opiskelijoiden liikkuvuusmahdollisuuksia hakemalla rahoitusta, tiedottamalla, käytännön tukitoimenpiteillä sekä kv-kumppaniverkostoa laajentamalla
- Kansainvälistäneet elinkeinoelämää välittämällä kv-opiskelijoille harjoittelupaikkoja paikallisiin yrityksiin ja yhteisöihin
- Aloittaneet kv-tutortoimintaa

Vuosittain kv-koordinaattori on laatinut toimintasuunnitelman, jossa on eritelty muun muassa prosesseihin, lähtövalmennukseen, viestintään, turvallisuuskysymyksiin ja projekteihin liittyvät kehittämiskohteet. Tämän liikkuvuushakemuksen aikana tavoitteena on kehittää etenkin terveyteen ja turvallisuuteen liittyvää valmennusta ja tukitoimia, vahvistaa kv-some-viestintää sekä luoda uusia, laadukkaita kumppanuuksia. 

LIIKKUVUUKSIEN KEHITTYMINEN
Liikkuvuusmäärien osalta Luksian vanhan kv-strategian tavoitteet ovat vielä saavuttamatta. Viime vuonna 4,1% opiskelijoista lähti yli kahden viikon ulkomaanjaksolle (tavoite 7%), ja Luksiaan saapui kv-opiskelijoita 3% aloittaneiden lukumäärästä (tavoite 4%).    Luksian liikkuvuusluvut näyttävät kuitenkin tasaantuneen nyt noin 40-50 lähtevään opiskelijaan vuodessa, ja osalla aloista on selvää kasvua näkyvissä. Viime vuonna Luksiassa toteutettiin 33 opiskelijoiden Erasmus+ liikkuvuusjaksoa, joista 9 henkeä oli ammattitutkintoa suorittavia aikuisia. Lisäksi 11 opiskelijaliikkuvuutta toteutettiin muiden verkostojen ja omarahoituksen avulla. Kevään 2017 jaksot toteutettiin päättyneen Erasmus+ KA1-hankkeen tuella, ja syksyn 2017 jaksot (17 kpl) akkreditointihankkeen tuella. Keväälle 2018 on toteutumassa ja suunnitteilla vähintään 14 opiskelijan liikkuvuusjaksoa sekä 2 asiantuntijan kv-työelämäjaksoa. Nykyiset määrät ovat opiskelijoiden liikkuvuuksien osalta siis huomattavasti suurempia kuin akkreditointihakemuksessa esitetty tavoite, 25 opiskelijaa vuosittain. Haemme tässä hakemuksessa liikkuvuuksia yhteensä 52 opiskelijalle.

Aikuisopiskelijoiden osuus liikkuvuuksissa on kasvanut erinomaisesti. Erityisesti hierojat ja pieneläinhoitajat ovat aktivoituneet merkittävästi, kun innostus ryhmissä on levinnyt yksittäisten opiskelijoiden liikkuvuusjaksojen jälkeen. Liikkuvuusjaksolle lähtijöiden prosentuaalinen osuus näissä aikuisopiskelijaryhmissä on suuri. Aikuiset lähihoitajaopiskelijat ovat aiemminkin olleet aktiivisia kv-jaksoille osallistujia, ja nyt määrä näyttäisi tasaantuneen 2-4 liikkujaan vuodessa. Perustutkintoa suorittavien puolella merkittävää lisäystä on ollut Luksiassa alkaneella uudella opintoalalla, kosmetologien parissa, joista viisi opiskelijaa oli liikkuvuusjaksolla syksyllä 2017, ja neljä on lähdössä keväällä 2018.

Asiantuntijavaihtojen osalta Luksia on jäänyt akkreditointihakemuksessa esitetystä tavoitteesta, 8 asiantuntijavaihtoa per vuosi. Yhteensä Luksia kuitenkin toteutti viime vuonna 10 pitkää (5pv+) asiantuntijaliikkuvuutta, mutta niistä vain kaksi toteutettiin Erasmus+ liikkuvuushankkeentuella. Tämä johtui osaltaan uuden organisaation aiheuttamista käynnistysvaikeuksista, ja toisaalta siitä, että suurin osa asiantuntijaliikkuvuuksista tapahtui Luksian koordinoimassa Erasmus+ KA2 strategisessa kehittämishankkeessa sekä OPH:n tukemien kv-verkostojen puitteissa (KEVA, ChiNet, Kanada-verkosto). Osa viime vuonna haetuista asiantuntijaliikkuvuuksista siirtyy siis ensi lukuvuonna toteutettavaksi. Auto- ja logistiikka-alalla on suunnitelmissa luoda ja kehittää uusia yhteistyökumppanuuksia. Luksian tavoitteena on lisätä huomattavasti asiantuntijoiden liikkuvuuksia eri aloilla ja sitä kautta innostaa lisää opiskelijoita kv-jaksoille. Haemme tässä hankkeessa rahoitusta yhteensä 8 asiantuntijaliikkuvuuteen. Määrä on varsin maltillinen, koska viime vuoden hankkeessa on vielä jäljellä asiantuntijaliikkuvuuksia, jotka voimme käyttää ensin. Olemme kuitenkin aloittamassa uusia mahdollisia kumppanuuksia mm. irlantilaisten, portugalilaisten ja espanjalaisten oppilaitosten kanssa, ja asiantuntijajaksot ovat siinä mielessä hyvin perusteltuja.

Abstract

     The qualification of human resources and the guarantee of certified professional skills are the current requirements of a society marked by globalization and by scientific and technological progress. Therefore, school must provide an effective response in terms of education and training.
      Our EDUCATIONAL PROJECT defines “the transnational mobility as one of the strengths of our educational policy, particularly regarding Trainings” targeting our students in Vocational Courses and “long term local, regional or national partnerships, and more recently international ones, with multiple scientific, political, cultural, social and business institutions”.

       The application for the Erasmus+ Program (which was unanimously approved by the Pedagogical Council of  january 7, 2018) aims to create an opportunity window to promote the mobility of students and staff, fostering a culture of tolerance and broadening horizons by the (re)cognition of other realities. However, the Agrupamento de Escolas Tomaz Pelayo also defends the principle that all students should have the opportunity of mobility, irrespective of their social or economic background, concerning the importance of these experiences, not only in technical and scientific learning but also in linguistic, cultural and social aspects. Thus, and given the economic situation of the Ave Valley region, most of these students would never have the opportunity to train abroad and live such an enriching experience.

      The project «PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCES» presented here, with the activity “VET learners in companies”, will allow students who are in the 12th year of vocational courses a unique experience of Training and simultaneously develop basic language skills for their life path.
       Students who will benefit from this project will be the second or the third year of Vocational Courses (Year 11 or 12 - Level III), of the following Courses:
Mechatronics Technician
Secretarial technician
Technical Industrial Maintenance / Metalworking
Electrical Technician
Technician of Electronics, Automation and Computers
Management Technician / Management Support
Computer Systems Management and Programming Technician
Thermal Technician
Admnistrative technician
        The school currently has 320 students in its professional courses, in 9 different courses. The high number of students and the expected number of interested in participating in the project leads us to request 3 more places than initially thought in the VET Charter phase.
       The project will take place in the period from june 1, 2018 to August 31, 2019 and students  will train for six weeks: Spain (Tenerife), UK (Londonderry), Italy (Brescia and Lecce), Greece (Syros) and Malta (Mosta).

       If this experience contributes to the integration of the beneficiaries in the European labor market without borders, also meeting their training needs, we will have achieved a very important goal to be proud of.
       But we want more...
       With this mobility project, we want our students to achieve technical skills and scientific skills that will enhance their ability to communicate in a foreign language,  develop a greater capacity to adapt themselves and learn more autonomously, assuming  and consolidating their European citizenship, discovering a new culture.

       We would also like to emphasize that our intermediate partners host young trainees from many other European countries, so this close contact with students of different nationalities also strengthen bounds of citizenship and belonging.

2017-1-FI01-KA109-034916 is first project for Raseko under VET charter. 52 students at Raisio Regional Education and Training Consortium (Raseko) perform their 2 - 12 weeks work-based-learning period abroad. Host organisations are from Spain, Great Britain, Norway, Germany, Malta, Sweden, Iceland, Italy, Netherlands and Portugal. There are 24 teacher mobilities also included from which 14 is responsible teacher for student's training periods, 4 special needs teacher/ accompanying persons and 4 teachers for advanced planning visit.  Additionally, we are applying 4 mobilities in teacher/training assignment for foreign lecturers from partner companies.

Participants study vocational basic, further and special qualifications. They practice their professional skills and some basic vocational qualification student will perform a vocational skills demonstration abroad. 2017-1-FI01-KA109-034916 continues Raseko's OPSM projects where students has performed several work-based-learning period abroad and tested skill demonstrations. Raseko will continue testing skill demonstration abroad in this new project. Raseko will test new local offered learning unit for international Work-Based-Learning which is created based on new VET legislation in Finland and also for new Raseko's international strategy where is a aim that all student will achieve one study module when being abroad.  The learning outcomes will be evaluated based on ECVET principals (knowledge, skill, competence and lifelong learning) by the work instructor, student him/herself and responsible teacher (local and teacher from Raseko). Gained non-formal learning will also be recognize into student's studies. In Autumn 2018 we will offer student's own individual study path (international study path) and local offered study module. 

During this project Raseko will have ITSLearning e-learning platform for the student's travel, language and cultural training and vocational training before the period, mentoring during the period and a report training after the period.

Through this project Raseko will gain, as an outcome, skills demonstration tasks and procedures which will be used when developing internship periods abroad and overall quality of the international activities. Raseko gets information on work practices and work cultures in other countries. Through this project Raseko is able to develop ECVET system with the help of host organisations and will be able to further develop mobility periods for special needs students. Through this project it is new feature for Erasmus+ (Erasmus+ Pro) will be tested in FabLab environments. Deepening FabLab cooperation and testing local offered study module are new priority areas in Raseko's new international strategy (will be made during spring 2018). 
In this project Raseko will apply grants for foreign company specialist who will work as lecturers in Rasekos' new development/Innovation centers (Raseko Foodlaboratory and Raseko FabLab). 

Articles in local newspapers, national seminars and national (SOTENET) or international (EREIVET, EfVET) networks of VET field are the means to disseminate outcomes. Internet site http://www.raseko.fi has information on project, travel stories, seminar material and experiences in skills demonstrations.
